description:
Super cute cafe in San Fran that I stumbled upon. The space is a little tight for seating or waiting on to go orders which is my only complaint. Otherwise the food looked delicious - avocado bagel sandwiches, and I ordered a latte which was delicious and the perfect temperature. A small was $4+ which is a little pricey given the size. 

Also OMG their homemade pop tarts are a must.
author: Tari O.

description:
Nothing has changed. Service still sucks. Hipsters still working slow, but at least their herb is legal now.

It would be great if they had a bigger bagel selection and could pay attention when I ask for my order to go.
author: Sarah R.

description:
I really like this place, the food, coffee/tea, ambience and people are all dandy.

However, the internet is so slow to the point of almost not being able to load web pages. In this day and age this is really ridiculous. I like to come here and work but can't since the internet is soooo slow!

PLEASE GET FASTER INTERNET :)
author: B r.

description:
First-time visit & find the interior very cool.
-Ordered yogurt w/ granola & fruits + honey drizzles. Tastes great. 
-Fast internet & great place for work
-Very limited seating though, I could not find a set
-Parking was also not easy to find. 
-Cute decor & plants
-Food is a bit pricey but good quality.
author: Jess W.

description:
Without a doubt one of the worst experiences I've had at a coffee shop. 

Went with my wife this past Sunday morning. We got in line behind a man and his daughter who appeared to know the woman working the counter as they had a long conversation in Hebrew as he ordered. 

After they ordered and walked away, the woman behind the counter stood there for a good three minutes waving and making faces at the child who was now sitting at a table just outside of the cafe. Meanwhile, a line had formed behind me that went all of the way out of the door and onto the sidewalk. Yet she continued to make faces at the child. Eventually, she took a cookie out from a jar and walked it to the child before coming back inside (by now there were approximately 15 people in line behind me). 

When she got to the counter, she looked at me and said "what?"

No "hello". No "good morning". No "what would you like to order?" Just "What?" as though I was annoying her by being there. 

I ordered a latte and a buttered bagel, my wife ordered a latte and asked the woman whether or not she could get a bagel with avocado. The woman responded "It's on the menu, you can read it" Yes, we had the menu with us and it was confusing as to whether or not it was an option so my wife sought clarification only to receive a condescending response.

I cannot remember the last time someone was so rude to us at a coffee shop, restaurant or any service industry position. It was mind blowing. It felt like she had a grudge against us for something but we had never been here before and had never seen this woman before. 

Beyond unacceptable way to treat customers. If I could give zero stars, I would. 

Finally, after being second in line only to wait over 15 minutes we had finally placed our order only to wait another 15-20 minutes for them to make two simple bagels!  

As if that wasn't bad enough, the coffee was average at best, and the bagels were stale.
author: James A.

description:
Really cute coffee shop. I love the patio seating and the hip interior. The service was also good. 

I ordered a soy cap (see in photo how it looks like a latte?) and it was very good! However, after getting through the first layer of foam, I was sad to see that there was only an inch of foam in my cappuccino, thus making it a latte. Regardless, it was really solid. 

My cousin ordered granola and it looked very good as well. I'm allergic to bananas so I didn't take a nibble but the portion was nice. 

Lots of people in this cafe working and reading so it's a bit tough to find a spot during their peak hours.
author: Steph G.

description:
The Apple & Brie sandwich was simply made, but really tasty! A baguette with slices of apples and brie with arugula and honey! Great combo of flavors. Good for a light meal or heavy snack. 

Pretty comfortable little spot, with both inside seating and outside.

Didn't try their coffee, so no comment on that.
author: Marc B.

description:
Don't be fooled by their homemade poptarts.

The price for one is costly and um...do you see the raspberry filling?

Yeah, neither did I. I just tasted dry crust and they said to keep eating until I got to the middle. 

Um, here's a picture of the middle. Where's the filling?

Average coffee but disappointing poptart, but since I want to support local businesses I'll give this 3 stars instead of two.
author: Jack R.

description:
I decided to take a walk through my neighborhood and after an hours stroll started feeling thirsty and hungry. This spot was quiet and looked decent enough so I grabbed a menu and ordered the salami panini. I paid and warmed a seat by the window while I waited. Then the cashier announced they were out of salami. Slightly bummed but an easy fix since I already had a second choice in mind... the apple and brie panini. 

Moments later a plate with a good looking panini was placed in front of me. I assumed the panini would taste as good as it looked and I was correct. The bread was crisply toasted without being so hard that it shaves the inside of your mouth. The brie was delectable and they gave a generous ratio of brie to apple and arugula. The honey sweetness on top made this a 5 star package because every bite got increasingly better. I would love to make this at home!

Aside from the 5 star panini, I also liked the staff and overall feel of the venue. It's a small establishment but comfortable and the staff made it more relaxing with polite chat. I noticed the male cashier initiated conversation with every customer and everyone ordering looked so happy during their stay and upon leaving. I don't think he was the owner (he seemed a bit too young) but he seemed to have a genuine like for his job which made my experience there better. 

I already know I'm bringing my friends here again soon and will be ordering the brie apple panini again and again.
author: Kristy F.

description:
Cozy neighborhood cadre with free WiFi and wonderful expresso.  Easy street parking on MacAllister and lots of tables inside and out.
Friendly staff.  Nice place to work in peace or enjoy coffee with friends.

Highly recommended
author: Richard D.

description: Had my usual (espresso) macchiato (how I compare coffee places). A beautiful roast that didn't get acidic as it sat for the two hours I sipped it. Would come again, for the chill and nice working environment.
author: Kimberlee G.

description: I went here to do a little bit of work. I ordered a cappuccino but while I was waiting for them to make it I realized that my laptop was dead and needed a charge..... but they have zero outlets. Well, actually, they have a couple outlets but they block them up so you can't use them. I didn't try a sip of the cappuccino because I needed to get work done so I left to find another cafe with outlets. I did eat a chocolate croissant while I waited, and it was similar to what you would get at Peet's or Starbucks, except they didn't offer to heat it up. One star for sunshine.
author: Maria G.

description:
Stopped by for a quick coffee on a Sunday morning. No real line at around 10:30 in the morning, which was a pleasant surprise. 

Ordered a flat white and waited 5-10 minutes for it to be made. Flat white was exactly as I like it.

Overall, a great spot with quick service, cute decor and reasonable prices.
author: Ryan C.

description: Super cute spot. Perfect for studying in the mornings. The chai is really good and their homemade pop tarts are worth it.
author: Hannah W.

description:
I'm confused about this place! It's on a cute street corner in a cute and more quiet neighborhood. The inside gets great lighting and there's outdoor seating too.

I got the Kenyan pourover but it just tasted too watered down. I would hesitate to get anything here again bc of how bad the coffee was. But the place is so cute I want to like it!
author: Jeanie N.

description: Seems to be run by hipster zombies, consistently. Weird. The pop-tarts from Black Jet Bakery are tasty. Else, meh.
author: Dan M.

description: Cute coffee shop with food and great drink options! I love that it's really easy to get to from my bus route (5). They do have free wifi, but I found that it was slow. I only wish they had more seating because it does fill up really fast, but they did cram as much seating they could given the small space.
author: Erica C.

description: I love this place because of the comfy, airy eclectic atmosphere, the lovely people, and of course the fresh coffee that fuels me at 7:15am on a Tuesday morning. I've yet to try any of the food, but it looks wonderful. Matching Half is the antedote to your pretentious laptop lounge. Samara(see photo) is my morning HERO!
author: Reuben K.

description:
Delicious lattes and homemade pastries coupled with a beautiful interior make for a great spot for a coffee date! 

Came here with a close friend and we both had a latte served in their cool ceramic mugs. We shared the nutella and black cherry puff pastry pop tarts- would recommend both of these! The baristas were friendly, and the noise level was at a comfortable level. Also saw people with laptops, so doing some light work here is also possible. 

Overall, a great place to catch up with a friend/hold a casual meeting at! Will be back when I'm in the city!
author: Robin Y.

description: Nice local spot to come by and have a cup of coffee in the morning. They have seating inside and also outside so you can enjoy the nice weather if you prefer. They also serve beer and wine, so after work if I want to have an alcoholic drink, I can come by and get a cup, which is nice. Coffee and beer all at one place, what else do you need??
author: Justin Y.

description: Lovely neighborhood cafe for lattes, cappuccinos, coffee or tea. They make their pastries fresh, and you can order sandwiches too! I tend to keep it simple whenever I visit, and I've never had a bad experience. It's not very large inside, but there's ample seating. If you're taking a stroll with your pet there's always the option of outdoor seating.
author: Ali R.

description: Great cappuccino. Comfortable atmosphere. If you don't want to wait in line for The Mill but want great coffee and a spot to read or talk with someone, come here! Didn't try the food but I'd like to next time :)
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Too small of a Café for as big of a crowd as they get always running out of inventory after long lines it would be nice if staff advised that they were out of items before you got to the counter after waiting a long time
author: Dustin S.

description:
Coffee was good but did not realized a Machiatto comes in such a tiny shot. But they was my fault; I should've known. Down it real quick before my hiking trip and it definitely kept me wide awake. 

The bagel with butter was toasted to perfection! Also had a raspberry pop tart and that was really good too. 

This place is super cute and adorable.
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Hands-down, best soy latté I've...ever had.
Very friendly barista/cashier. 
Fast service. 
Quiet/cozy.
author: Grace W.

description:
I've been here many many times over the several years. Service is always nice enough. 

I've never received a HOT cappuccino or latte EVEN when requesting extra hot. On at least a half dozen visits, I have to microwave my expresso drinks to make them actually hot. So if you love great tasting luke warm lattes and cappuccinos then this is your place. 

That is all.
author: L D.

description:
A small cornerfront venue packed with people working on laptops out of whatever table space they have, Matching Half is nevertheless a dependable neighborhood cafe offering inexpensive drinks and a limited food menu as well.

If you're into camping out here to do some work, you'll have to jockey for table space, let alone a power outlet. If you're bundled up in enough layers and have enough juice in your laptop or tablet, the outside tables are a better option to get some people watching in, alongside your "work."  

Service is fast and efficient, and again this isn't a bad neighborhood venue. Not necessarily worth a special trip, though.
author: Vincent L.

description: Food is good, if a bit pricey, and the service is friendly.  Not a great place to work as they play loud, distracting music (despite asking them to turn it down several times), their wi-fi is painfully slow and takes minutes to load a single page, and no outlets for charging. Wish they would make it more work-friendly considering the majority of the people who come here are looking for a quiet place to work.
author: Sasha D.

description: It's a cozy place, and beverages are nice. Especially their coffee is good because of using Sightglass's beans. However, their WiFi is so slow. Therefore, I think if you want to use a laptop there, I can't recommend there.
author: Yumiko H.

description:
With easy going staff and cute decor, this place is great to hang out and get work done. They have delicious coffee - serving up andytown roasters finest and to your liking! They have alcoholic dranksss and a couple options on tap. The food is fresh but is a bit pricy. They have a lot of seating and lovely music. 

The reason why I docked off a star was because their WiFi IS THE WORST! Seriously, it feels like I'm using AOL dial up from the 90s in this place. Also, there is no WiFi password, so there's a chance a guy in the apartment next door is stealing all your information. Butttt if you're looking for a place to catch up with a friend or read/write, this is the place for you.
author: Michelle N.

description: A sunny morning, but it's ruined by the server with attitude, dressed up with dark red dress and earrings. I'm not sure if she's being discriminate to a Chinese. She's rude, unprofessional, ruining the brand and the reputation of this cafe.
author: Annie Y.

description:
I've never understood this place but it's in my neighborhood. This past visit, it took over 10 minutes to even order and there were only 3 people in front of me. Then I waited an additional TWENTY minutes for two bagels and cream cheese to-go.

...They literally operate their "kitchen" from a toaster oven and panini press. They nuke their eggs in a microwave for those breakfast sandwiches. It's almost entertaining to watch them try to cook ham in a toaster oven...Until you've been watching for 20 minutes.

If there's been enough time for me to write this review, you've taken way too long. Will not be back.
author: Chanel H.

description:
A great medium-sized hideaway cafe in a residential neighborhood away from the main street craziness.  Love the vibe of this place...chill background music great for working/reading/hanging out; a mix of bar, individual table, and booth seating; a simple yet unique interior design that gives it a cozy eclectic feel.

Eats and libations...
- Sightglass coffee
- Fair selection of breakfast/lunch items
- Beer/Wine selections for later in the evening

Parking...much easier than other locations, with 2hr and 4hr street parking.
Added perk...close-by stops for those of you with a sweets/carb-loving tooth like me include Mills Bakery and Chile Pies Baking Co.  #winnerwinnerchickendinner

Definitely a top spot for me in this neighborhood :)
author: Mon T.

description:
This place is so cute! It's my favorite coffee shop in NoPA - very reminiscent of European cafés 

A great quality I love about Matching Half is they serve all of their coffee in ceramics handmade by the owner :) 

P.S. Great balance of milk to espresso in their macchiatos
author: Judith P.

description: Good chai latte but the girl who made the drinks was unfriendly. We said we were taking our drinks to go. They gave my fiancé his coffee in a to-go cup but had mine in a glass cup. So I asked her if I can have mine in a to-go cup and she gave me a dirty look like it was my fault. First time and probably last time here.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Cool little cafe in NOPA. 

I don't drink coffee, but the tea was good. I also got a bacon and avocado sandwich on an everything bagel here for under $6, which is pretty unheard of in SF.

The service was a little slow, but I'm an impatient east coaster. 

Overall, good prices and good vibes.
author: Michael B.

description: Nestled in Lower Haight, this coffee shop has really great cold brew. They also have other espresso drinks that are top-notch. My only reservation is that it gets particularly crowded on weekends, so this is not necessarily the best place to do work.
author: Edson M.

description: My new usual! I've met up with friends here, made it a study spot and also grabbed coffee on the go. The food and coffee is amazing and the customer service is too! I love the feel of the place and how welcoming it is. Highly recommend it!
author: Emily H.

description: This place can never seem to get it right. I'd say I don't know why I keep going back except that it's next to my bus stop so when I'm in a rush in the morning and haven't had a chance to make breakfast, it's the easiest option. First time I ordered the breakfast sandwich with avocado on brioche and they made the order correctly. It just tasted so bland. I added a ton of salt and pepper and it became okay-ish. The homemade pop tart was also pretty tasteless and lacked filling. Next time I order the same thing and somehow end up with a blend of the veggie bagel and breakfast sandwich. It's a hard stale bagel with an egg and a slice of avocado on it. What? Didn't even add cheese. Next time they straight up put ham on it instead of avocado. I just don't understand what's so hard about it when there are only about six items on the food menu. This doesn't happen to me anywhere else.. In summary: Drinks were okay, food is bland, order is usually wrong.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Loved the yogurt and granola. So fresh. Jasmine loose leads tea was unbelievably perfect. Wishing my Russian bf were with me
author: Cherry J.

description: Good coffee, solid service, good atmosphere, but I really wasn't feeling the music. Not a very chill playlist so it was a little difficult to get some work done. Lots of rock - which I am sure many people enjoy but it just wasnt for me.
author: Mariam B.

description: Nice coffee shop in the center of NOPA. we love to come by and sit here for a cup of coffee in the weekends. The food sometimes takes longer to be ready.
author: Gali S.

description:
I've had this cafe bookmarked for months now, and I have a friend who frequents this establishment so I decided to join him one afternoon. It has a laid-back feeling to it. Kinda cute. There's coffee and food, so it would be ideal to camp out for a few hours and get some work done. Originally I found Matching Half Cafe on a list of coffeeshops ideal for people working remotely.

For a place that's good for remote workers, it was frustrating that all of the outlets along the back wall didn't work. Strange. I do like that Matching Half is multipurpose with its coffee service during the day and eventual availability of wine and beer. I wouldn't feel too compelled to come back here but would be open to another spontaneous rendezvous with my friend.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Great coffe and fresh croisant. Also ordered a delicious breakfast sandwich. Excellent service!
author: Jeff B.

description:
So I happened to stumble across this cafe on an eater list as a good place to study and bring your laptop .. however all their power outlets don't work and it is a VERY small place that only fits a small communal table in the back and several small 2-person tables along the window, some in the aisle, and bar seating available.

Aside the fact that it's a small cafe and I wouldn't recommend to study or spend a large amount of time here, I think it's cool that they're more of a local cafe by the panhandle and serve a variety of beverages from coffee, wine, and draft beer on tap! My boyfriend and I came here to do some studying and get work done but I felt a little uncomfortable and squished knowing I couldn't spread out all my study equipment around me like I'm used to doing. I got their white peony tea and he got a breakfast sandwich & coffee with bacon that looked and smelled really good. My tea came in a little cute teapot and they also came around to refill my water! Even with the small space around us, we did manage to get what we wanted to done and he even got a glass of wine later.

Parking here isn't too bad to find as all the blocks are pretty much street parking. The interior of the cafe is nice and cute; they have two living mini walls and they have textured walls with some hip patterned wallpaper.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Wow, I've been here before and had a decent lunch, but breakfast here this morning was just awful. 

I ordered an iced coffee, bagel with cream cheese and breakfast sandwich to go....it took literally 20 minutes. The coffee was a tiny 12oz portion and not even filled to top of the cup. The bagel had barely any cream cheese, which is absurd considering the cream cheese cost $2 by itself. (And when a NY Jew accuses you of skimping, you know you're doing it wrong.) Finally the $8 breakfast sandwich: microwaved rubbery eggs, barely any cheese or avocado. Did I mention the service was terrible--no apology for the wait, no napkins given with this "to go" order; everyone was still half asleep and it was 9:15AM. If I wanted a breakfast this shitty I could have gone to McDonalds and saved $10. This place should step up its game or it will be losing more customers like me.
author: Rachel E.

description:
I kept passing by this place and never stopped. Now it shall be my new fuel stop after a morning run to carry me over my final SF hill on the route to home. 
It's a cute tiny neighborhood cafe where you can work on your laptop while enjoying a quick bite & coffee. It has a hipster vibe. 
They have limited outdoor seating, imagine would be nice on a sunny day. Visited on a lazy sunday afternoon. It was not crowded and we were able to find a table for 4. Heard from a friend who frequents this place that Saturday mornings there is quite a line for breakfast.
author: Suna L.

description: Shoutout to Matching Half Cafe for quality caffeine, snacks, food, alcohol and ambiance. I'm a customer for 5 years for quick drinks to go, catching up with friends and doing work. Always nice to get out of the house and hit them up, where it feels like a home away from home.
author: Alexander M.

description: Classic neighborhood joint with great sandwiches  nice people, great outdoor seating if sunny.  The Apple and Brie sandy is awesome. Also great breakfast sandys.
author: Nick A.

description: Great little coffee place- free wifi, outside seating but currently under renovations. A little over priced on food- but tastes good. Breakfast sandwich on a croissant like bread with egg, cheddar and choice of avocado of meat. I chose avocado because those bad boys are expensive to get these days.
author: Leslie S.

description: It was worth the hike. Unassuming, neighborhood cafe with excellent coffee and food. Friendly service!
author: Ebru C.

description: Cute local cafe, decent coffee, good sandwiches, great decor, free Wi-Fi. Only problem is that it got uncomfortably warm to sit there on a sunny day. An awning or umbrellas on the Baker Street side would help a lot to make it more comfortable.
author: Em D.

description:
While the macchiato I ordered was more milk-heavy than I think a classic macchiato is generally made, I thought it was great and didn't mind that surprise. If you like very little milk I'd recommend specifying that, but i had no complaints because this one was so good, and the steaming was expert. 

I also picked up a homemade jalapeño pop tart which was delicious. 

My only complaint about this place might be that it was full of people on laptops - not sure if they offer wifi but it looked like it, and I'm becoming more and more partial to cafes that don't provide internet access.
author: Adrienne S.

description: My boyfriend and I were on our way to the Japanese Tea Garden and decided to stop by and try their chai latte. Let me just say, that was the best chai latte I've ever had. I also had a very tasty peach pop tart. The wait is a bit long but we'll worth it!
author: Sandra R.

description: Overpriced but I love it. Yummy Chai Latte, great sandwiches, tasty salads, and a good place to sit and read or do work.
author: Lana B.

description: This review is only for their breakfast sandwich which is ham (substitute for bacon for 50 cents more), cheddar, and egg. The sandwich was fine/tasty enough; three stars though because it was a relatively small sandwich and a "just fine" sandwich, at a fancy price of $7.50. I liked their outdoor seating and location, being off the main Divisadero strip.
author: Will H.

description: Chill atmosphere, good coffee/bites, good tunes..which is why people seem to campout here I guess. Certain times you won't get a seat inside but if you can, it's a nice place.
author: Juli C.

description: Excellently executed espresso, and coffee. They have both indoor and outdoor seating and also serve wine and beer.
author: Callum B.

description: Matching Half is a go-to in the NoPa neighborhood. It sits just close enough to the panhandle of GGP to snag a cup and take a morning stroll. One of their best offerings are the homemade pop tarts. Get here early to snag your favorite flavor like Nutella! The staff is friendly and cheerful even when you show up at exactly 7AM when they open. Also check out their spin on oatmeal cream pies. PS their pastries are delivered fresh every morning from Black Jet :)
author: Natalie O.

description: Great friendly coffee and breakfast place not far from USF. They make really good breakfast sandwich and serve a variety of different coffees.
author: Hank M.

description: I am always sad to leave San Francisco, but at least I found a great coffee shop to warmup while I pack my bags. Matching Half located in NOPA has deep fried pop-tarts, a great tea and coffee selection and bubbles as well! They have indoor and outdoor seating which makes it convenient to find a spot to sit! I came back to this spot twice it's so good. I remember since I was little that the coffee shop preceding Matching Half was not so successful, but I think since my neighborhood demographic is changing with techies and students, this makes it a great space to work or blog.
author: Cecily B.

description:
Matching Half Cafe has exactly two things going for it:  (1) the beautiful building and (2) the cute sign.  It's also situated interestingly on a hill and has decent outdoor tables, but I said two things and I'm sticking with two things.

Everything else about this place is annoying.  It's expensive.  Food takes forever to come out.  Portions are anorexic-model-in-training meager.  It's frequented by all the annoying people who have moved into my neighborhood in the past five years.  It's uncomfortable inside.

It reminds me a lot, in fact, of One World Cafe, which it replaced, in a way.  But whereas One World Cafe was merely disappointing, Matching Half Cafe is disappointing, annoying, and pretentious--and that's a pretty good description of how my neighborhood has gotten worse since 2011.
author: John S.

description:
Mannn, I have such mixed feelings about this place. Here's a quick breakdown:

PROS
-Great food, great coffee, AWESOME baked goods
-Nice vibe, lots of natural sunlight
-Friendly staff 
-Very clean and pleasant bathroom
-Outdoor seating available
-Right on the 5 bus line
-ALCOHOL (wines and beers)

CONS
-No power sources
-Long wait times
-Limited seating area

Essentially, this place is fabulous as a spot to get a jammin cup of java and to enjoy a pleasant breakfast, brunch, or lunch with a friend. The food is great, vibe is chill, and the overall quality of the establishment is great if you can get past the fact that the friendly staff just kinda take a while to get orders out. 

This is a BAD place if you want to camp out to get a bunch of work done with your computer. Yes, there are outlets. No, they're not going to charge your electronics.They turned off the power sources for a reason. I can understand this from a business perspective. They don't want you camping out for 10 hours taking away precious table space. They want to flip those tables and keep the money coming in to stay in business. I get it. I can't hold that against them. 

I do have to say that my Lox bagel did take a good 15-20 minutes and it was not extremely busy. But then some other people around me got their food within 5 minutes of ordering, so it's not like ALL of their orders come out super late. Just keep timing in mind if you're in a rush.

Overall, I'd definitely come back to this place for a light meal/date with a friend, but definitely not to get work done unless I'm going all paper.
author: Cara O.

description:
My brother and I met up here for lunch today and it was an excellent spot to spend a couple hours eating lunch, having a beer, and then enjoying coffee while watching people pass by outside. The space is a little tight for the lunchtime surge, but the fact that it surges is its own signal! 

I had a turkey sandwich with avocado and tasty chips on the side, and washed it down with a pilsner. My brother had a regular coffee, which he reported as very acidic, but my double espresso cappuccino was perfect.
author: Robert V.

description:
The matching half cafe. Went there with some people and tried the grilled cheese, turkey and Jack sandwich, and the salami baguette. I wish I could give this more stars but it was just a little pricey, with a drink the meal would be $15 easily.

The sandwiches were good but the grilled cheese was definitely way too oily for my taste. The turkey jack sandwich is fit for two people while the salami is fit for a child.

Seems to be a local favorite, there were lots of hipsters and students lounging around.
author: Amanda W.

description: Super cute cafe with tables lined up next to the windows for lots of light. Quiet neighborhood with low traffic and not much street noise. They have a serious cookie collection and homemade poptarts (nutella??? dayum!!). I like the old skool ice-cream-parlor countertop seating, and there are lovely stained glass windows that filter in blue light. Tea/coffee + a pastry will run you $5 - $7. They have the requisite milk-ish options: skim, almond, soy. Downsides are that the seating is limited, there aren't any (working) outlets if you want to plug in, and the wait can be long if you come at the wrong time. Oh, and if it's cold and rainy they won't close the door because "the windows fog," so bring a coat. Otherwise - customer service is friendly and intimate, coffee/tea selections are top notch, and it's a lovely place to sit and work if you've got an hour to spare.
author: Ray J.

description: Cute hipster coffee shop. I enjoyed the coffee, but it took a long time when I went on a Saturday morning. Like a really long time it felt like.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Fun little coffee shop in the neighborhood. Great selection of coffee with good bites and wine.
Baristas are really friendly and good enough space to sit and do your work. I was here for 3 hours and got a lot of work done. Not noisy at all.
author: Sailaja B.

description: Really nice space and community cafe. Unfortunately the people who work there are NOT friendly at all. Really doesn't feel like you are welcome or that they appreciate your business. I have also been there 3 times and have had a similar experience every time. Cold brew was very weak as well. Bummer because I had high hopes :(
author: Ben G.

description: Wonderful coffee and service.  A bit of a long line at times but moves along smoothly.
author: Gregory H.

description:
Want to find the geographical center of the city?  Apparently, if you come here, you're there.  

This is my neighborhood cafe, so I may be a little bias, but I love Matching Half.  Unlike other reviewers, I only have the occasional problem with the wifi and if you ask the baristas, they are more than happy to give you tips to improve your signal (like walking towards the door to grab the signal before sitting at that back table).

I usually get a pot of tea and work.  Their tea is good, but they always leave the leaves in, which will make the tea too bitter.  Easy fix by tossing them out after a few minutes.  They're much more focused on coffee, but I never drink the stuff so I can't comment on that either.

But if you're looking for a nice quite cafe to get some work done in the literal heart of the city, this is it.
author: Jessica A.

description:
I used to love this place. 
Now it looks like it is becoming one of this pretentious cafe. People there used to be friendly and paying attention to customers, now it looks like nobody cares, they make you wait for ever etc.... Very disappointing
Also, same problems that have been existing for a while (read your reviews!!) : no power outlets and VERY BAD wifi. Like, if you offer wifi, offer a descent connection or don't offer it at all. Somewhere in the middle is just making your customers frustrated.
author: Marion P.

description:
Okay - loveeeeee this cafe!

Delicious lattes.
Yummy breakfast sandwiches.
Awesome vibe.

And.......GREAT customer service.  Like when you're treated like a regular, but you're not.

Random story:  Was killing time here waiting for a ride.  Store was closing.  I was worried bc I had just gotten my hair done at a salon across the street, and it was raining.  Asked if I could wait in here.  Said yes and offered me a free muffin.  What?

Love love love.

:)
author: Ruchi P.

description: okay coffee with reasonable price. great place to study. food was ok too. the shop itself is very cozy and has wifi. there is no plug so make sure your laptop is charged!
author: Helia S.

description: Neighborhood gem. Great coffee & breakfast or lunch. I found the service to be fine and I was there on a weekend morning. The coffee was really good, and yeah it did seem a little stronger, I like my caffeine buzz!!  Had a homemade jalapeno poptart, it was so flakey and good, yum yum. A nice little seating area outside. A great place!
author: Karen R.

description:
Matching Half Cafe is thebomb.com!

I discovered the cafe a few years back when I was living in the Haight. I used to stop in with a good book and order a nice cup of tea or a kale salad. Last week I had the chance to return after one of my close friends moved to the neighborhood. We were walking to Divisidero when I took a detour to show her some other local businesses. That's when we wandered in! 

It's a quite space with nice artwork and a killer playlist (very important). They sell a variety of coffee, tea, wine, and food. We just ordered drinks, but the food that I've had in the past has been very good. Staff is friendly and they have wifi. My friend also loved it and I know she's stoked to have such a nice spot so close to her apartment!
author: Rachel S.

description:
Come here if you have nowhere to be. If you don't mind waiting over 20 minutes for a basic breakfast sandwich, this place is for you!
I wouldn't mind waiting that long if there was someone actually cooking my eggs, but when it's a dude making them in a microwave, my patience starts to wear out. 
I'm sure the person who made my sandwich is nice and all, I just wish I would've seen a little more hustle from him. 

For a mediocre sandwich, I didn't think the wait was worth it.
author: Danny H.

description: Mediocre. The food is nothing to write home about. Coffee and such is just about the same as every other place. If you live near here this is a nice spot. But I wouldn't go out of my way to visit or bring people here saying, "ya gotta try this!". It's a small space and the line is often too long. Would not come here for a quick caffeine fix. Best to only visit during non peak business hours. Staff always seems pleasant.
author: Emily D.

description: It's my favour neighborhood cafe! Nice vibes, good coffee and the home style decor just made me productive while staying there! My favors combo are the cafe latte and the breakfast sandwich. One thing though,they are a bit pricey , $2.75 for a coffee and around$7 for the breakfast sandiwch, so if you plan to have a big breakfast, come with friends to split even the costs. They are also busy during the morning but the wait isn't crazy at all.  A very nice corner cafe!
author: Yuki J.

description: High end coffee and lattes set the bar for this modern cafe. There are a few outlets at the group table for those looking to camp out and get some work done. But I really love sitting at one of the outdoor tables nicely shaded from the morning sun that bakes many of the other local cafes. The cherry muffins are also great and bagels come from the House of Bagels one of my favorite local bagel shops.
author: David A R.

description: In line at Matching Half, once again marveling at the comically slow pace at which the whole place operates. The coffee is very good, as is the food, but be prepared to wait ~10 min for a cup of to-go drip coffee and about a half hour for anything else.
author: Michael R.

description:
Oh this place soothed my soul just right, a perfect wide windowed stone and wood space with beautiful, warm delicate Sight Glass coffee and a few taps of SF beer, Magnolia and Sudwork, and simple, fresh tasty food. Non-snobby staff who chatted easily with each person who came in no matter how third wave savvy their coffee order. Behind the counter they talked excitedly about ideas for future dishes and events.

This cafe is a short walk from the Haight in a cool, residential area with a few other bars and shops, but none of the touristy bustle. Maybe it was because the sun came out and the fog burned off while I was here but this was the moment I began to feel like SF was a place I could love and live in. I get bummed and freaked here sometimes by the heartbreaking poverty and nauseating gulf between rich and poor, but that's when I have spent too long in the financial or touristy sectors. Getting out to a real neighbourhood where food and drink are served with a love for local and a quiet mellow sunny rhythm heals all, always.
author: Risa D.

description:
Perfect place for working! Good coffee and sandwiches! 
The place is very quiet and peaceful...
author: Hagit S.

description: Lack of plugs. Lackluster service. Crap coffee and a cold brew that is more like a sludge of coffee (you are supposed to strain out the coffee grounds). 0.45 Mbps down and 0.15 Mbps up... Two stars is because the food is good but made without gloved hands.
author: Mischa S.

description:
The cafe that's literally across the street.

Service is slow, and delivers on quality. 

The seating area is pleasant. On the inside, broad windows stream in daylight, and provide a grand view of the neighborhood. On the outside on a nice day, this particular corner of McAllister and Baker gets some nice sunlight.
author: Michelle J.

description: Great coffee, great food, small space.  A victim of its own popularity, the biggest issue is finding a seat to enjoy your meal.
author: Irwin P.

description: This coffee shop is perfect for so many occasions - study spot, coffee run, Sunday morning recovery food. Their breakfast sandwiches are so freaking good, especially the delicious buttery crunch from the brioche bun. I've tried their sandwiches which were all right but nothing compares to their breakfast sandwiches! No morning routine is complete without one of those :)
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
Laptop camper here. This charming café in a Victorian building is the hipster hangout in this part of town. The food and coffee (Sightglass) are a step above the normal coffeehouse fare. There's something homey and cute about the place. I like the stained glass windows, the wood floors, the wood counters, wood chairs and plants. 

The bagel sandwiches looked hearty and delicious. They also have baguette sandwiches and pastries, including Black Jet Baking pop tarts. Wine and beer are available.

* Yogurt parfait http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/matching-half-caf%C3%A9-san-francisco-3?userid=NOUfyJW-BAo_-Cbfo8edww#GaZE94jTbvqN3C4tcjifOw: Very nice, made with Straus organic plain yogurt, fresh fruit, 18 Rabbits granola, walnuts, and a drizzle of honey. 

The wi-fi is free, fast and secure. Campers, it's a noisy place with tables that are too close together and there's only one outlet. There are some communal tables, outdoor seating and counter seating.

You know you love me. X0 X0, laptop camper.
author: Lolia S.

description: Loved it! Friendly staff, delicious coffee, yummy food! A little on the pricey side but hey, this is San Francisco.
author: Nishant G.

description: I used to come here a little too often when I went to USF.   I always order the Tomato Basil Panini and it NEVER disappoints.  The place is small but it's what makes this cafe a little bit more "SF".  I only give it one less star because of amount of time it takes for them to prepare the food and also because it can be a little pricey.  Nonetheless,  I intend to return many more times.
author: Avni P.

description:
When I moved to my new neighborhood, I was afraid that I would be leaving my old coffee shop without a replacement. I'm so happy that Matching Half is around because yay! now I have a replacement. 

The coffee is good, the sandwiches are delicious and piping hot (and I mean really hot... be careful), people are really nice, the bathroom is clean, and they have free wifi! Wifi is free, but private. Ask for the password when you buy something.

Because the power plugs don't work, you can't stay forever, which makes sense, but, come with a fully juiced laptop and you can definitely stay a while. Although small, it's not overly crowded or noisy. And on nice days, you can sit outside.
author: Mariko F.

description:
Simply great coffee and pastries, and perfect location. I come here all the time when visiting my girlfriend since she lives a few blocks away. 

The mocha is always on point, and the chai is amazing. Nice quaint little place that is perfect to sit and chat with both inside & outside seating. Great for studying. They even have a little bar where they do serve a few beers on tap. 

Definitely one of my favorite cafe spots in SF. A hidden gem that is not crowded with fixie bikers.
author: James M.

description:
Cool place to study while drinking a beer/wine or coffee. 
They have outdoor seating, just limited outlet space for your computers so come charged!!!!
author: Dede C.

description:
Nice and small cafe to get shit done. Their salads actually look amazing and their chai tea lattes (my go to pick me up / get shit done drink) were quite nice.

Downsides: kind of a small cafe, so I can see it being hard finding a table or place to sit. In addition, only one power source! And I wasn't really feeling the music when I went (a bit on the rock-ish side?). I also wish their wifi had a password and wasn't free.
author: Christina C.

description: This place has great coffee and a delicious turkey sandwich.  Their salami da which with butter and cornichons is also outstanding.  It's a good quiet place to work too.
author: Jay R.

description:
The food is pretty good, but it's just slow as faaaaak. They just move at the same turtle pace no matter how busy they are. it's super duper annoying. I just want a coffee and it's just hit the ten minute mark. 

15 mins and I've got a coffee, there were 3 espresso drinks before me, let's do the math here let's see....it takes way to long you lazy hipsters. Just a liiiitle bit of hustle would do you wonders.
author: Penguin P.

description: I've been dying to try this place, as I always pass it while visiting San Francisco. Overall, the experience was 3/5 stars, but I'm giving it 4 for the ambiance and friendly staff. So I ordered a Gibraltar and yogurt with granola and my dad ordered a breakfast sandwich. The Gibraltar was ready in under 2 minutes, which was great. However, the two items we got took about 15. My yogurt was done after 5 minutes maybe and it just sat on the kitchen counter while they slowly prepared the sandwich. The wait sucked, but the food was delicious, including my now-cold Gibraltar! The girl who took my order was really kind and the interior was super cute. Hopefully I can come back here soon and stay a little longer!
author: Dom L.

description: Intimate spot with excellent coffee and food. I ordered an egg, ham and cheddar sandwich and my wife had the egg, avocado and cheddar. Both were delicious! And the barista knows what he's doing. His soy latté was spot on. We will be back.
author: Steve C.

description:
In general this is a really cool place. The coffee is great and the food looks amazing (haven't tried it due to food allergies). It's easy and close to my house and the wine/beer part is such a little Celt touch. Bathroom is always clean and in general the atmosphere is very solid. There are a few things that consistently annoy me though:

The service is pretty slow. I definitely don't mind when people spend time on making me a lovely latte and or put the extra effort into making something yummy for me but fuck... My time is valuable too! When I see the barista chatting with her friend or other co-workers  at the end of the bar (happened on multiple occasions) while I'm waiting to order it doesn't make me feel like a valued customer. I'm patient but let's be realistic here. It shouldn't take me 8 min. to just order the coffee. 

Second, the wi-fi is always in and out, which is a little perturbing when I'm there doing work.  

Other than that, this is a cool little neighborhood place when you have some time to kill and chill.
author: Krista G.

description:
Some fun hidden menu options you should check out:  They have a gibraltar, which many like with almond milk.  They can swap out yogurt in the granola bowl for steamed milk, which is interesting on a cold & damp SF morning.  My one wish is that they'd use a greek style strained yogurt for that bowl.  They can also make you a lox salad since they keep smoked salmon on hand to make lox bagels; nice if you don't eat bagels/sandwiches yet still love meat.

Other fun things to do here:  Order a banana when they're super ripe and spotty brown; goes great with espresso drinks with milk less the or equal to cappuccino level.  Check out their changing arrangement of artwork every few months.  Currently, it's an installation of small canvases with colorful, dancy geometric patterns.  Sit down next to their card/flyer section when you're flying solo.  Peruse the various yoga instructor, tech startup, meditation, photography, acupuncture, and other curious services available.  If you come on the sunday streets day, they typically have a cool live band playing.  Last time it was an quirky, malt shop doo-wop set.  

Finally a word of advice: The food here is best for snacking and less for lunching/brunching, so have the right expectations in mind.  The espresso machine/drip coffee is rightly the main event.
author: Andy H.

description: I just stopped in here to grab some coffee but given how inviting the interior was, chose to order a sandwich as well. First off, I ordered a cappuccino, which was served beautifully, but the espresso tasted a little over extracted. However, I didn't let that ruin the experience. I then chose to go with the apple and brie sandwich and that was just delicious! The apples gave it a slight sweetness, while the arugula and brie balanced it out with peppery, creamy savoriness. It was a delightful treat to stumble upon!
author: Carly B.

description:
Very friendly staff.  Had the Apple & Brie sandwich, which was delicious.

If you're bringing your laptop, make sure it's fully charged.  Only one of the outlets works!
author: Brendan Q.

description:
Matching Half makes some great mochas (particularly when Jason is on duty), and they have good customer service. The downside is that bagels can take up to 30 minutes. I've had to wait 10-15 minutes for bagels when there was no line. Why do your bagels take so long? I can't figure out if your set up is bad, employees are slow, or what exactly is the problem. 

Would be a nearly perfect cafe if you can figure out the bagel problem.
Love your mochas--keep making them as is!
author: Andrea R.

description:
Yummy coffee, friendly staff... It's on the sunny side of the street... Bud most of all this place is privately owned by a local owner, which make me feel good about giving them my money. It is my favorite coffee shop in my hood! 

They have hand made pop tarts! I mean really!!!
author: Jeannette F.

description:
Cute cafe, cute pastries. Some people complained about the drinks being luke warm but I thought they were just perfectly brewed, I hate when my espresso is brewed with overly hot water because it comes out overly acidic. 

Would love to come back for the breakfast sandwiches and pastries!
author: Jess C.

description:
This is one cool neighborhood. But is it because of cafe's like Matching Half that have taken up residence that has added the cool factor, or is it because the neighborhood has made cafes like Matching Half cool?

It's the classic chicken or the egg argument. 

Either way, this is a nice find and an excellent coffee shop to pass the time. There is free wifi and plenty of outdoor seating that captures the warm afternoon sun. The coffee is a major hit and they serve up San Francisco's own Sightglass. They are so cool that they even use iPads for credit card payment.

Like the minimalist decor and the "cool" but friendly service. 

One of word of warning, they have home made Pop Tarts!
author: Rene C.

description: Love this cafe! Great food, happy staff, perfect location. This place feels like home, so welcoming :)
author: Diane V.

description:
Dark iced coffee, wood tables, big windows with cool afternoon light. Gardens in wine glasses. Eclectic wooden art in layers over the back wall. 

A perfect place to work or read.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
yum!

good espresso, limited seating on a late sunday morning.  drinks came quickly.

jalapeño poptart is good
breakfast sandwith is more than filling
the "large" sized turkey sandwich is really 2 meals in size and delicious

also they may have had a slayer espresso at some point but now its a standard la marzocco strada
author: steve a.

description: People are nice but politeness and smiles doesn't make up for this place's shortcomings.   This coffee shop does not have a way to charge devices.  They have actually turned off their outlets.  They even say no power on them.  Basically, buy coffee or whatever and then don't let the door smack u n the ass on the way out. Don't want you hanging out very long here.  wtf?  They also charge full price for every cup of coffee.  gentrified crap really.  Coffee is better at my house.  Not a bad place to chill 4 a minute but as far as coffee shops go I'd check out another place.  plenty close by.
author: Seth C.

description:
It's a nice cafe, good location, good coffee, but:

1) there's never any seating, since the space is so small
2) the internet is down half the time, spotty the rest
3) the music often ends and the workers forget to turn it on again, so I sometimes find myself sitting there in dead silence
4) when I ordered a small sandwich (that costs $6.50), the waiter forgot my order all together.  I reminded him 20 minutes later, and then he tells me they're out of bread and I'd have to get something else.  

If you're going to buy skinny hipster jeans, make sure you can fit them.  Likewise, if they're going to sell themselves as a trendy third wave cafe, they need to fix some operational issues and earn the money they expect customers to pay.
author: Khoa N.

description:
5 stars for the Raspberry Cheese Pop Tart. It was amazing.

5 stars for the lox bagel. It was so good. 

2 stars for the coffee. It was so bad.
author: Emily D.

description: Staff are friendly and coffee is good, but don't order the grilled cheese.
author: Michael S.

description: Great neighborhood coffee shop. Friendly staff, good coffee and other food and beverage offerings. The only major problem is TERRIBLE wifi. If you are looking for a coffee shop to do some work - find another place. Otherwise, it's solid 4 stars.
author: Kirill E.

description:
Matching Half is a pleasant, comfortable place to get consistently good pour over coffee. 
They use Sightglass beans. (used Verve before Sightglass was roasting) 
They offer a few pour over coffee options to choose from. 
The people working there are nice. 

Best coffee in this neighborhood, hidden away on a quiet corner.
author: RK W.

description:
I've only been here once due to a recommendation from a friend. It's a great study spot with free wi-fi. However, if you come with a large party, expect to split up. There's limited indoor seating and most of the tables are tables of 2. There's only one large table that fits up to about 8 if you squish.

It took a while for me to find the menu, but they have it on the table by the cashier. They also take card. So you don't have to worry if you have enough cash or finding an ATM.

Their food is really good! I had their grilled cheese. Their breakfast sandwich is quite popular. I saw many people order it. I had a bite from my friend's and it was delicious. The breakfast sandwich and the grilled cheese was quite large. I couldn't finish it. Their sandwiches range around 6-8 dollars. They also have baguette sandwiches which my friend said was delicious, she had the salami, and it was smaller in size if you don't have much of an appetite.

They also have quite a variety of house coffees. Their drips range from 2.50-4 dollars. I haven't tried their espresso.

They provide a bathroom, plus! Another nice little thing they have are hooks under the bar table so you can hang your bag, convenient if you bring a book bag or purse.
Downside, they only had one outlet, but there was a little sign that said no power on top so I didn't bother to try to see if it worked. So bring a fully charged laptop or extra batteries, or a book.

You will also have to find street parking. There's lots of metered parking, but if you venture out another block or so there are also residential areas. Just hope you get lucky!

The staff are very nice and I plan on coming back!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Really good coffee and nice sunny location. 
They need more power outlets though. If you want to work here, charge your battery prior to coming over!
author: Caroline K.

description: Quiet, cozy, and good coffee for a refreshingly non-San Francisco price (less than $3 for a good cup). 4 stars because not much outlet access so it's not a good all-day work spot if you're on your computer, but the weekday daytime environment is definitely good for brainwaves.
author: Amanda J.

description:
Nice little corner cafe, serving up Sightglass coffee, bagels and homemade pop-tarts (genius!) in a warm and airy space. This is a great spot to grab a table and enjoy a coffee and a chat.

What it isn't great for however, is take-away. There is next to no room in front of the counter/machines which makes waiting a challenge - and they don't take your name, just slap down orders on the counter - which means you can't wait outside. What happened instead, was a group of us dancing around each other trying desperately not to spill scolding hot coffee on each other. 

Take-out blunders aside, a cute cafe and one that I suspect would be a lovely to enjoy on a quiet afternoon with a glass of wine. And a pop-tart. That's a combination, right?
author: Mel P.

description:
Very nicely done cappuccino. I'd post a picture but I drank it already :-(
Selection of sandwiches, salads and baked tasty things looks great too, and the prices are pretty low. And they have beer and wine. All good reason to come back :-)
author: Nicki R.

description: Great little spot to come and do a little work. Free wifi but be prepared with a full charge. There's only one working outlet (intentional) in the whole place and it's near the milk/sugar station to discourage long term squatters. Coffee is solid and the sandwiches are good albeit a little pricey...
author: Denis M.

description:
Don't you love walking into an establishment to get a coffee and a bagel first thing in the morning only to be met with pretentious hipster attitude? (it's not cool to be a hipster, guys) You think that elitist attitude makes people want to spend money? You work at a coffee shop, a pretty crappy one at that. I mean, I'd expect it at a place like Saks, or Neiman Marcus, but a neighborhood cafe? No, you think you're so freakin cool with the cable knit sweater you stole out of your grandfathers closet, and your goodwill loafers you wear sock-less, Gross! I don't know who owns this place, but they seriously need to do some retraining in customer service, hygiene, and dress code. No one wants to buy food or drink from a dirty, unbathed jerk. Seriously guys, you work at a coffee shop, you're not that cool. NO stars are deserved. 

P.s. the coffee sucks, it's overpriced, and a bagel, plain, not even toasted or cut, is $1.75. WTF. a bagel you have to do nothing with should be 50cents...I don't care how "good" you say the bagels are. Unless it was personally flown in from New York by Mel Brooks, IT'S NOT WORTH $1.75. Jerks!
author: Barney B.

description: Amazing chai lattes. Also a little pricey but their breakfasts are perfect. The breakfast sandwich is my favorite
author: Meaghan W.

description:
Don't necessarily expect to get your cold, bland food in a timely manner. But the coffee's great. I also like the small and cozy atmosphere.  Despite the hipsters always associated with third wave coffee joints the folks baristas are generally cool.

Read update!
author: D.J. L.

description:
This is my local so I love it. It's got wifi, really friendly barista, takes Square, and both indoor and outdoor seating.
Their coffee is really consistent and stronger than other places which is what I like.
Only down side is no real gluten free food options.
author: Van-Anh N.

description: Not sure how long they've been carrying Gillian's Black Jet Baking Company pop tarts, but I'm so excited that I now have a place close to my house to swoop some of her delectable treats! Today's flavors included jalapeño cheese, raspberry, and coconut kiwi. If you haven't tried them yet, you're missing out!
author: Ruggy J.

description: Latte is great. People are nice but power outlets doesn't work. Seems like they don't want you to spend more time in there.
author: Kevin S.

description: The coffee/chai is solid but the food is basically how an average person would make a sandwich or bagel but add 5 dollars to the price - nothing special.
author: Rohan S.

description: Reasonable priced and very nice staff.  We popped in after we visited the Farmer's Market to get some coffee with the pastries we just purchased.  Though they don't have a large selection, what they have is good especially if you like your plan 'ol cup of joe.  I also got a macchiato, though it wasn't what I had expected (Yes I go to Starbucks way too much)... None the less it was delicious, and I think we were speaking with one of the owners and discussed why they don't carry any type of flavored coffee drinks (ie Vanilla), and he explained that it just takes away from the flavor of the coffee... Though my sister touché'd him that he let patrons add milk/cream and sugar to their coffees... He was definitely nice, and very passionate about his Café, which I liked.  Ill make sure to stop by again for another cup of joe when I am in town.
author: Bryanna P.

description: Fantastic coffee. Good ambiance. Good service. Great place to spend an afternoon getting work done while enjoying the buzz generated by a great latte. Definitely worth the long walk to get here. The only danger is I won't want to leave.
author: Josh S.

description: Excellent and well-made coffee - they make a good Flat White. The lox bagels are delicious with good wild salmon and the Large sandwiches are huge. The place has a good chilled atmosphere and nice outdoor seating that faces the sun, up a hill on a reasonably quiet street.
author: Andrew P.

description: We had a cup of granola & yoghurt and a breakfast bap. All perfect and served quickly. However the server forgot our tea and coffee. As we're from the uk we're not used to your half and half milk which is disgusting in coffee and the breakfast bap was very heavy on my stomach for hours afterwards. Not a great experience.
author: Alex B.

description: The atmosphere here is quite nice and the barista was kind to explain what's on the menu and help find something that I would enjoy. Definitely would love to come back and just have a lax day drinking a cup of cappuccino on a sunny day.
author: Alvin L.

description: Nice place. Chill music and relaxing atmosphere. Only WARNING for people going there to get work done: they don't have power outlets except for one in a corner away from the tables. So just make sure you have enough power on your devices.
author: Erik G.

description: Cute interior, nice enough baristas, neighborhood cafe, but they only have one functioning outlet by the front counter for the entire cafe! If you want to come here to work make sure your devices are already fully charged. People have to take turns using the one outlet if they are running low. And their internet was really slow and it was cold inside. Not the best place for cozying up and being very productive.
author: Shayan S.

description: Really tasty bagel, good crowd coming in and out. The shop seems like the perfect size and just right amount of coffee noise in the background. Also big windows to get a san francisco-esque view. Only complaint was that I was charged a whopping $2 dollars for a drip coffee refill after i had ordered a $5 dollar latte.
author: David M.

description:
Small, quiet hipster cafe. I like how there isn't much foot nor car traffic going through that intersection. Plenty of outdoor seating for when the sun comes out.

Guatemala drip from spyglass roasters was enjoyable, but its far from the best coffee in the area. They have a few local craft beers on tap as well.

The inside gets stuffy on warm days. Otherwise, its a good place to work or wind down. The power outlets DO NOT work, so charge your electronics or resort to getting annoyed.
author: Alfred L.

description: Love my local cafe! The staff is the best it's ever been. Friendly, remembers your order, knows your name, and always takes pride in their coffee and food. If you are looking for a smile and a sunny seat outside while you sip your afternoon away, matching half is the spot.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Best cafe in my neighborhood. People there are always friendly and Jason is especially affable. I hope they stay around a long time. The clientele seems diverse to me and kids are welcome. I could care less about how many power outlets are accessible - happy to see laptop addicts go somewhere else if that's really an issue. 

My only complaint is that when the bosses aren't around, the service is sometimes ridiculously slow, if still friendly. If it takes 20+ min to turn out a panini on a non-busy weekday afternoon, then either something's wrong with the workers or the kitchen facilities. But it IS a tasty sandwich!
author: Frank B.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by this place when a friend introduced me to it. The coffee is great, but be ready to know what you want because they only have a teeny tiny menu on the counter telling you what they offer. This is a place where coffee pros will feel at ease, and bubble lovers can get their fix. I quite liked their bar-style seating.

Criticisms: terrible seating! The available chairs are uncomfy and the outside area is awkwardly sunny. Expect to squint at the person you're talking to a lot a lot a lot if you come here mid-beautiful-day. The inside echoes so it's not a good place to hold a conversation.
author: Sterling D.

description:
What's the point of outlets if you're going to label them with "No Power"? Lame.

Good work environment, though, if your laptop is charged.
Good tea selection.
Good service.
Food seems a bit overpriced.

Seriously, though, allow people to use your outlets!
author: Neeharika B.

description:
After dinner at Green Chile Kitchen I wanted some dessert. More specifically I wanted a cupcake. And even more specifically I want a mini cupcake. Just across the street I saw Matching Half Cafe and just inside the window I saw a bakery dish full of mini cupcakes. Joy of joys!

I danced in and inquired of flavors. They had standards like vanilla cream and red velvet and not-so-standard like peanut butter chocolate and cinnamon horchata. I immediately ordered a vanilla cream and the cinnamon horchata to take home. The vanilla was standard as you'd expect - with cream cheese frosting and quite moist and delicious. The cinnamon horchata was just as decadent as it sounds. I will be back to have another. And another. And maybe even another. Don't judge me. We all have our weaknesses you know.

It's a cute coffee house and if the cupcakes are any indication they know what's up in a kitchen so I just may be making my way over here more often. If this is in your 'hood you'd be wise to do the same.
author: Tiffany N.

description: I have only been living in this neighborhood for a few weeks and I already love this place. Great coffee. Great food. Outdoor seating for when I get a dog. Only negative.....it's always so hot inside. There will come a day that weather may not allow me to sit outside and when that day comes I will have to go elsewhere. Because it is way too hot inside. But I love the coffee and the service is top shelf.
author: Elgin A.

description:
Going to the DMV stinks but it doesn't have to be that bad because one can just walk 4 blocks to this wonderful neighborhood cafe for a cup of jo.

Coffee is great as is the atmosphere and the people that work there's attitude. 

I'm glad to be done with my DMV issues but will miss the Matching Half Cafe.  Maybe I'll have to do a special trip back...
author: David A.

description:
For a quick on-the-go Sunday morning breakfast, this was a nice stop.

I ordered a small cup of drip coffee (made by Blue Bottle) and as a critical coffee drinker, this was excellent. Dark roast that wasn't burnt or acidic = happy camper. I was pretty hungry and knew a croissant just wasn't going to cut it. Luckily, their breakfast sandwich caught my eye. Warm brioche bun with quality ham, egg, and melted cheese? Om nom nom! 

Small Drip Coffee + Breakfast Sandwich = $10 (for SF, average)

Really nice atmosphere in there and friendly baristas. Service was a little slow, but it was pretty busy in there. Normally I don't mind, but I was on the run. Also, usually I like to sit at a cafe and if I wasn't taking it to-go, there would have been no room to sit. Pretty small place and lots of people in there. So keep that in mind when looking for a study spot. 

Sum It Up: Yummy Food/Drink, Average Prices, Limited Seating
author: Sasha T.

description:
Decor & ambiance - amazing.
Service - okay. 
Chai tea latte with soy - okay, kinda watery, nice foam though. 

Kinda lame how it doesn't have working outlets. There's only one out of three and that one is only accessible to one table.
author: Jessie W.

description:
How did the hipster burn his tongue?

By drinking his coffee before it was cool.
author: Amy C.

description: Great location, atmosphere and free wifi, but my latte was just so-so. The wifi is a bit slow.
author: Amin S.

description:
Stopped by to do some homework around noon and found it very crowded, mainly people on laptops, reading, ect. (they do have free wifi)
I ordered a breakfast sandwich on plain bagel with a hot chocolate. My hot chocolate was quick, although it could have been a bit sweeter it was good. My sandwich took a little longer but it was also very enjoyable. 
Overall, the place is a bit small and can get crammed and the food is a bit overpriced. But it had a cool/trendy atmosphere and the customer service was good. 
Cool little coffee shop to visit!
author: Atzay P.

description:
Some of the best coffee I've had in SF. Amazing breakfast sandwich and really good homemade pop tarts. 

Great outdoor seating, wi-fi, and really interesting artwork.  

A great place to get the day started.
author: Daniel D.

description:
Five dollars and twenty minutes later, you're sitting at a sturdy blonde-wood table sipping a dixie cup of coffee staring at a wall terrarium.  DO YOU FEEL COOL YET?

If you're not wearing Tom's or pleather mid-90's ankle boots, don't even dream of walking in this place.  Also, only bring Lincolns b/c all the prices are in multiples of fives and they don't give change.  Enjoy some cheerful banter while you order?  Get out of here, you friendly freak!  Can't you tell by our radical hairstyles that we're a terse team of coffee-brewing wizards?  

The coffee is good.  Worth everything else?  Up to you.
author: Ellen C.

description:
+3 stars for well crafted cappuccinos, lattes, and excellent dark brewed drip coffees

+1 for very cool, helpful staff that never fails to go the extra distance to make sure clients are taken care of. 

There's outside seating that faces west - it catches sun for 3/4 of the day until sunset  - a great place to go for when the east-facing outside seating at Mojo has darkened halfway through the day.

Trust me on this one...
author: Mark S. I.

description:
I've been coming here since I moved to the neighborhood 2 years ago. It's my favorite place to get some work done and the food and drink (coffee, wine, beer) is rock-solid. The lox bagel and the turkey sammie are where it's at. If only they could improve on their iced coffee.

Matching Half is busiest on the weekends (beware the precious toddlers with their parents) and most lovely and serene on weekday afternoons (perfect if you're trying to be productive). As others have noted, they have free wifi, no outlets, and mellow staff that - per the SF norm - take their time but do so (imo) in a friendly, non-annoying way. 

Lastly, they use Square so using a credit card is not a problem. In SF, this is a rare but welcome feature.
author: Emily M.

description:
I love Matching Half, it's definitely my go-to coffee shop / cafe--and I have a lot of choices by my house! The staff is super nice, most notably the male owner-he's the shit. 

Whenever I'm slightly hungover, I always get their mozzarella tomato basil sando, which is grilled--it's my favorite and always makes me feel more prepared to face the day. Their other sandwiches are tasty and above par for most coffee shops. Coffee is exceptional quality..my only beef? I REALLY WISH they had a larger option for iced coffee! I can down a lot of iced coffee, and with all the ice needed, their small size always leaves me wanting-especially because it's so good. 

A lot of the art is done by Workshop, across the street, or other rad artists. Oh, and for those of you cashphobes, they now accept credit cards, which cannot be said for every cafe in this city!

Go matching half!
author: Afton T.

description: The bagel lox were spectacular! Also the kale salad. What makes the salad so great, other than the fresh ingredients, is that they like on the feta! Most places skimp on the cheese, but not matching half. Keep up the good work!
author: Sam M.

description:
Big, big fan since I'm in the neighborhood and have been dying for something other than Starbucks, the Lucky grocery store drip coffee (where they have an "honesty tin" to pay for your cup o' joe), and the hippie-fied place on Central and Hayes. 

Clean design, sweet looking espresso machine with dark wood accents, large windows for lots of light, beer and wine options (with happy hour), and various bagel/snacks to keep things going. My first few visits when the place opened, I was served some pretty tepid cappuccinos, but his has much improved lately. Great coffee (due to great baristas).

Cash only.
author: Jasmyn M.

description: ZERO STARS! This coffee shop sucks! The staff is horrible; rude, pretentious, entitled. Not only are the prices outrageous compared to the quality of the products the provide, but they HANDLE FOOD WITH THEIR UNWASHED BARE HANDS AFTER HANDLING MONEY. Never going back here again. I live on the block, and I'd rather drive across the city to get a bagel than deal with those hipster douchebags. (They don't deserve any stars, but yelp is making me leave at least one)
author: Crimson Fiona M.

description: Came here on a weekend visit to SF, and found this to be a first-rate neighborhood cafe in all regards: even when super-slammed, the (adorable) staff were friendly & attentive, the coffee (from Sightglass, mm!) well-prepared (we're coffee snobs, and my date had one of the best cappuccinos we found on this SF trip, while I had some super well-balanced drip), the breakfast sandwich tasty and a great value, and the decor super-cute.
author: myrrh l.

description: Absolutely my favorite cafe in this neighborhood! Their coffee is excellent ! The staff is always friendly and most of all their food is delicious! The small baguettes are a must- especially the salami baguette with cheese and pickles! The pop tarts and the pastries are also really good  ! This place gets really full Saturday and Sunday mornings, but it's worth the wait!
author: Therese H.

description:
Love the coffee, snacks and location but make sure to take into account that (with no line and after you placed your order) it will take 20 minutes (!!) for them to make your lox bagel ($8). Consistently 15-20 minutes. Same with many of the other sandwiches. 
This is simply too long.

Update:
Seems like they read their Yelp reviews! :) My lox bagel recently has taken just around 5 minutes. Go matching half!
author: Pep G.

description: Seriously, Best coffee place ever. Well, at least for me. Love the breakfast and the Chai latte is amazing.
author: Amalie A.

description:
I'm sitting at work drinking a perfectly reasonable latte from Unnamed Coffee Chain and thinking "wow, 99% of coffee now tastes mediocre at best thanks to Matching Half." Yes, it's that good.

Also thinking "I wish I had one of those awesome chocolate chip cookies - the ones sprinkled with sea salt. Yummy."
author: Janna M.

description: Was really excited when this place moved into the neighborhood. They cleaned up and modernized a very dated space.  They had good food that was appropriately priced for the quality - coffee may be a bit overpriced.  The owners seemed awesome and I was really rooting for them to succeed - I still am.  The reason for the three stars, you ask?  WTF is up with the bad attitude of the people working there?  I'm in MHC once a week and about 90% of the time, there is no sense of urgency, there are no smiles, there is only this cool, detached, hipster indifference to the customer.  Being a neighborhood joint that you want to frequent, this seriously bugs.
author: mark h.

description:
There's really nothing all that special about this place, but I like it. 

It's only a few blocks from my house, and I've stopped in a few times. As far as drinks go, I've only tried the brewed coffee and it's fine. I've tried a few pastries (I think a muffin or two and a croissant) and they were both good as well. It's a pretty basic menu as far as coffee and espresso goes, but I kind of like that. No nonsense!  I think in addition to typical coffee shop pastries they do serve sandwiches and salads, but I've never tried them. 

I've never actually hung out there (I've just popped in and out), but it's a cute little location with a friendly staff. They also have free Wi-Fi.
author: George A.

description:
Coffee is strong, tasty and expensive.

Mature hipster vibe.

Good SALMON LOCKS BAGEL

the Green Chili brunch into matching half drip is a winning combo...
author: Walker C.

description:
Hey Matching Half!  Your "living wall" is DEAD!  Along with it's living little circular saw buddy.  Oh, I get it, irony!  You can pick up some new air plants and succulents just around the corner at the plant shop.

Even though you kill your plants I like you Matching Half.  First of all, you are a cafe, you you gotta have coffee.  Sight glass makes some pretty bomb coffee and you save me the trip down to SOMA to satisfy my craving (though I don't know if I have tested your espresso machine skills yet).  You ice you cake with home make pop tarts that are soooo good, today I almost iced myself with some traffic making a U-turn to go get one.  And home made oreos too!  Good thing I have a little self control.

You are also a pretty chill little place to sit, inside or out.  Free WiFi (no plugs, you low battery life suckers).  And stained glass peacocks.  Easy access to pie shakes, a green burrito and craft training college.  Far enough away from Divis to get rid of some of that drabble.  Maybe some day I'll try your meats between some breads.
author: Adrian L.

description:
Great lunch spot. 

Small but inventive selection of sandwiches, good coffee (Sightglass) , and good (small) beer selection. I had a tomato mozzarella panini with a green side salad.

 Sitting outside on a sunny afternoon at Matching Half cafe is very nice. Sunny cafe but seating is limited inside.
author: Leuwam T.

description: our neighborhood go to coffee shop. i love sight glass coffee, they offer almond milk, the staff is super nice, and food is great. they just repainted and wallpapered and it looks good. only negative is they can often be slow as molasses.
author: Tatum T.

description:
There's something that I don't get here. 

- They have a great location. Nice bright space, big windows, on the corner, outdoor seating.

- Interior is relaxing, modern, clean. 

- Music isn't loud and dumb. They play jazz, blues, and oldies at a modest level. Like not awkwardly silent, nor obnoxiously loud.

- They have free Wi-Fi. Here's the doozy: there are NO WORKING POWER OUTLETS!!!!!!! 

You would think that it's an epic combo like peanut butter and jelly - cafe wi-fi + power outlets for your laptop...but no...this does not exist...

I wasted $2.75 on an iced tea just to sit and check my email til my partially charged computer died 20 minutes later. Sigh. 

So sad that a place so cool has to shaft you like this. Minus stars, stars, and STARS!!!!! 

I go to Oasis Cafe now though their coffee is sub par. But they have outlets (like a real cafe!) and nice little nooks and quiet space.
author: Peng M.

description:
I met with my book club ladies here one Sunday afternoon and I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and coffee at this place.
Espresso was strong, the staff was smart and knew what they were doing, it was clean and it was well run.
It's a little small if you have more than one other body with you, but it seems like a great neighborhood place to swing by for a quality cup of coffee.
The only issue was that they don't take cards, and that sort of cramped my style since I hadn't gone to the bank before swinging by the cafe. Luckily my friends love me, and have cold hard cash  :-)
author: Kathy K.

description:
good coffee house. only one left in the area.
