homemade pop tarts. 

and here's a bunch of text I'm going to include just to make this long enough to qualify as a boba fide review. stupid yelp!
author: Steve F.

description: This is a perfect little corner cafe to sip and stare out the windows, maybe even get some work done on the free wi-fi. The baristas are pleasant and the chocolate chip cookies are delicious.
author: Leah R.

description:
I'm a bit surprised that some reviews complain about coffee size/strength/temperature. I like a strong americano, and at other cafes I usually have to ask for room because they put too much water in it. Here they put it in an Italian A.C.F. porcelain cup (looks like 190ml), and it's been perfect every time I've been here. If you like it at Mojo, you'll like it here. [Update: I've been here over a dozen times now and it's always a perfect cup.]

I didn't frequent this place back when this was One World, it was just another panhandle cafe. I preferred to ride my bike to Coffee Bar. But Matching Half is great -- it's bright, airy, clean, not terribly crowded despite being a small place, and the people are nice, not stuck up at all. The outlets on the back wall don't have power, but that's good so it's not overrun with laptops.

Oh also, they're always playing great beats. Half the times I'm there, I pull out Shazam.
author: Tom P.

description: Mmmmm.... mochas yummy! Very pretty presentation. Its a tad on the too sweet and weak side but still quite tasty. Clean, trendy space with outdoor seating. Nice location (quieter street traffic). Friendly prompt service.
author: Chelsea D.

description:
I come here for the dog watching. It's amazing.

The coffee is pretty good too.

Only compliant is that the line moves very, very slowly.
author: Hillary W.

description:
After reading the other reviews, I'm not sure if I just got lucky or what, but the folks working there were nice enough to me, and the espresso and apricot tart were fantastic.  They even heated up the tart to give it that extra special yumminess.

The place itself is very cute, with a number of seats outside as well as inside.  I almost gave them five stars, but it was a tad on the pricey side (although I would say it's worth it) and for the life of me I couldn't find a menu.  Perhaps in my early morning haze I just missed it?  Well, no matter.  The apricot tarts are right there on the counter and I suspect I'll be going back for more of those and maybe I'll find the menu at a later date.  Can't wait to try the regular drip coffee next time!  :)
author: Christian D.

description: Great ambience, good coffee, and wonderful place to get some work done in the sunshine.
author: Samuel J.

description:
I like my Latte here, only Blue bottle has managed to impress me in this country... and now these guys.
This guy knows what he is doing even though he's NOT A GIANTS FAN, yea you know what I am talking about.....yup.

It's all good in the hood.....literally!

Stay handsome!
author: cecilia k.

description:
This is my favorite cafe in the area. It's a bit out of the way, two blocks off Divis, on a quiet corner with lots of sun in the afternoon. On a nice day you can sit at the tables outside, and when the weather gets cold there's plenty of seating inside. I love how cozy this place feels. 

The drip coffee is great while the cappuccinos tend to be on the bitter side. I think this is just the style of espresso drinks in SF though - all the fancy (blue bottle, ritual, etc.) cafes serve something similar. The food is pretty standard cafe food, nothing too exciting.
author: Victor L.

description: Great yuppy hipster cafe with super capable baristas and yummy food.
author: Tyler M.

description:
Favorite cafe to work at in the area! Always quiet, bright, clean, and playing music you can work to. Baristas are usually really friendly, too. Just be warned- tables can be hard to come by, and outlets are non-existent. 

 They have tables outside that are usually available, so it's a perfect place to sit and chat on a nice day.  

While this is a great place to get stuff done or unwind, it definitely ISN'T the place to get lunch. Food is overpriced and very few options.
author: Kristen C.

description: Great coffee and pop tarts!!!! I had a chai and my fiancé had a latte-both creamy and spot on flavor wise. We also split a breakfast sandwich that I had kind of low expectations for (they microwave the eggs) but I was pleasantly surprised! Nice little outdoor seating area as well.
author: Nikki S.

description:
Love love this place. This is my go-to spot for the perfect cappuccino. I also love their  breakfast sandwiches, and their pop-tarts are pretty delicious too. Such a cute spot to hang out, great ambiance and atmosphere.

Matching Half is also great for a good beer in the evening. They feature some really great bands.
author: Sara N.

description: Cute little coffee shop. Their mocha was great and the pastries looked yummy! Would definitely go back.
author: Vivian H.

description:
I love this place and come regularly for coffee and lunch. I am glad the power outlets are turned off to avoid people camping out all day and taking up the limited seating.

The main thing that would make me give 5 stars would be reduced price refills. I know free refills aren't economical, but $1 refills (like they do at the mill) would be superb (it would be nice to have a second cup after that sandwich, but not at full price).
author: Justin T.

description:
Decent coffee; average food; great atmosphere.  

This place gets low marks because of the strange, not-quite-rude, service.  They refuse to put espresso shots in ice coffee out of principle and fairness , as their beans are of such high quality that to do so would be an act of sacrilege so offensive to the coffee gods that it's safer to offend the customer by refusing.  

They also have a strict policy of asking if you'd like them to add half-in-half and *then* directing you to do it yourself after you answer "yes".  Very bizarre.  

It remains to be seen whether one can buy an espresso shot to add to their iced coffee without being run from the store.  

Since the whole debacle left me with surely a more bitter taste in my mouth than espresso over ice, I'll be taking my bean-water money elsewhere.

UPDATE:  This place reminds me of the coffee shop featured on Marc Maron's show, where the snotty barista refuses to ice his latte.  Look, your coffee is good, but when I purchase it, it becomes my coffee.  If I want to ice it, that is MY decision.
author: N Q.

description: Just wanted to add that this place plays the BEST music. I rarely find myself wearing my headphones cuz they have such good taste- especially in the hip hop genre. Kudos MH. Kudos.
author: Tiffany M.

description: It was really good drip coffee, I like the way they served it to me and my friends. The workers are super nice and the shop is very clean. The price was good. We got two cups for 5 bucks. It was priced pretty good. I will go back for sure
author: Jonathan W.

description: I have a "thing" for corner cafes and anything in corners (keep your thoughts clean, people!!) Matching Half is wonderfully located at the corner of McAllister and Baker. What a gem. This delightful shop makes sandwiches, has pastries, Sightglass Coffee, teas, loose leaf teas, and a limited selection of wines. I am here mainly for some study space. There are about 6 tables for two and one large community table in the back for eight. There are also a handful of stools at the bar. This space is cozy, but there's room to luxuriate in all that open air-lots of light-humbly decorated space. I ordered an iced English breakfast tea. They have wifi for those who need the Internet. Unfortunately, there aren't any outlets for use... there are some in the back (hurrah!), but they are all labeled "No Power" (womp. womp.). Eh. In the end, I'm just happy I found another great coffeeshop to do some thinking, brainstorming, theorizing, conceptualizing, problematizing... (I'm a humanist. That's what we do.) Enjoy.
author: James Z.

description:
I just moved in the neighborhood and looking for a good cafe with good coffee. This place doesn't disappoint. Like so many places, the make each cup of regular coffee via a manual drip system that is excellent. You have an option of premium coffee from Sightglass. I have tried Guatemala and it's worth the extra $1.

They also server beer and wine. They have limited but excellent selection of beer on tap. Magnolia, Marin brewing company and others are represented. The wine list is decent.

The food is OK nothing over the top. The pastry selection could be better. Overall a good place for coffee, beer or a glass of wine.
author: Subhash J.

description: Matching Half Café has friendly baristas, reasonable prices, a well-lit space, and good coffee. I went on Sunday afternoon and it wasn't crowded. What more can one ask for? I'll be going back!
author: Peter A.

description:
Quick and Simple:

This place is a fabulous little coffee shop with a chic urban feel. With a feeling of Blue Bottle --and a little more edge and charm courtesy of its location and feeling of independence -- this place inherently had my heart. And my caffeinated soul.

The espresso I had was fantastic. The service was fantastic. The vibe was superb. Matching Half Coffee -- a HUGE success.
author: Thom S.

description: Super cool spot. Great coffee (pour over). For the pour over, you can select from a few different locations. I always get the Guatemala, which is great. They have nice outdoor seating, and plenty of space inside as well. Coffee, is pretty pricey, but it is super high quality.
author: Chris D.

description:
-great coffee
-tasty food
-friendly service
-clean, welcoming atmosphere

bummed i don't live down the street from it anymore.
author: Alicia J.

description: Love this place. Love all the staff, and great spot for people watching. Became my go-to cafe after moving to the area, and especially after Sophie closed.
author: Randy K.

description:
Fuck all you people complaining about the outlets. I'm sick of you clogging up every available table at every café in SF.

That said, this place is awesome. Great coffee, wonderful people-watching, great décor, delicious food, and NO LAPTOP ZOMBIES! WOOHOO!
author: Henny B.

description:
Recently at the Matching Half: 

Stopped by with a friend a few hours before close.  The fellow behind the bar gave us some good-natured flack for splitting a cup of coffee and then delivered it to our table.  It was a gray day, but the place still gets fantastic light, and it's hard to be gloomy when they've got their soul playlist on.  The Matching Half has an unbelievable cast of adorable kid patrons, and this time the baristas were helping a well-behaved little guy with whiskers painted on his face distinguish between the recycling and the compost.  We stayed for a beer and got generous samples of the two we were choosing between.  At close, they offered us the leftover pastries and let us try a new kind of drip coffee.  If you're looking for a coffee shop to make your rainy afternoon. . . .
author: Joanna L.

description:
If you like a cafe based on the view from the window then this is the plae for you. The windows are among the best in the city. Huge and overlooking a few nice artsy Victorian houses, best view from a cafe in all of SF. Wh? Because its not overcrowded with cars and yet the rumble of a sweet neighborhood is constant. 

Right on the 5 bus line. Muni peeps love this. 

Just got some new loose leaf teas.
author: bob m.

description:
This is my second review today: this one and one for Blue Bottle in Hayes.

Both have great coffee. Both make great coffee drinks. Both have reasonable prices.

The difference is that staff at Matching Half are much friendlier.

The only criticism I have for Matching Half is that it'd be nice if they either removed the "coffee pot for two", "coffee pot for three" from their menu or started stocking more Chemex equipment.
author: Emmett K.

description:
I was wandering aimlessly on the streets of Turk and Lyon when I all of a sudden found myself craving a smooth cup of coffee. I didn't know of any cafes nearby, but then I stumbled upon Matching Half on the corner of McAllister and it was love at first sight. 

This place is tiny, but it has all the right moves. First off, it's in a great location. I can see this place being one of "go-to" spots for coffee the next time I meet up with someone. If you need a cafe to hit the books and study, you might want to consider Matching Hat. Whereas Starbucks is constantly busy with people coming in and out, this cafe seems more modest and mellow. 

The windows are huge, so the place is very well lit. Decorations are minimal, but the overall vibe is a solid "cool" in my book. You get the perfect amount of caffeine fix for just the right amount of money. For just $4, you can get a delicious Chai Latte that's perfectly blended. They also have assorted, healthy muffins and cookies. The cranberry oatmeal raisin cookie is bomb. I will definitely be back for more, and more.

Keep in mind, they only accept cash!
author: Linda T.

description:
It's a hipster watering hole. 

Espresso is on the mild end. Doesn't help if you're looking for a richer blend, something to shock you out of your morning drowse (might have to go for a double or triple then).

The interior and quaint ambiance has really grown on me. Here's why:
- amble seating inside, few outlets discourage laptop campers so the cafe seating fosters more of a conventional cafe and chat environment 
- cute bar counter seating
- plenty outdoor seating - come here on a nice day, overcast even, and you'll have the sun shining nicely over you. 
- great music not too grungy nor too ambient. I get reading done here without the background music distracting me.

But otherwise service is poor. They're not personable nor efficient - between 3 workers and 2 customers, they couldn't identify who had a regular coffee and who had the decaf. I mean, it's not like there was a rush....
author: Annie L.

description: Pssst.....it's the best coffee curation (if you drink black) around. Just don't tell anyone :)
author: Mario C.

description:
A cafe that reminds me of home!  I'm new to the neighborhood.  I ordered my favorite drink and this has been the only cafe around that didn't correct me on how to order!

Not to mention, my americano was delicious!  And so is their sea salted chocolate chip cookies!

Can't wait to try out  more...
author: Trisha M.

description:
My fiance and i just moved into the neighborhood and we were praying there was a coffee place EXACTLY like this near by. 

The brew to order drip coffee is fantastic and the espresso is even better. This place takes a lot of care in making each cup of coffee or latte and you can taste it! 

Also they have one of the best breakfast sandwiches ever! Seriously amazing.
author: Dan L.

description:
This cafe has the best cappuccinos hands down! Their pastries are fantastic I think they get them from local bakeries every morning. Their morning bun which has orange zest inside its so tasty and refreshing at the same time. Plus it's small so you don't feel like you've just eaten like the Pillsbury doughboy. 

The only complaint I have is this place really does take their coffee seriously so be prepared to wait. If you see a line you'll more than likely be there for the next 15 minutes or so.... it's worth it!
author: Maria M.

description:
I'm a big fan of Matching Half, its a wonderful place to relax and I find the staff and owners to be excellent people. There's always something new and interesting popping up there, I'm a big fan of the salted chocolate chip cookies and the mini cupcakes. Their chai strikes that good spot that's both sweet and salty, and they make a good cappuccino. 

The whole place has a peaceful, airy feeling during the day, and a chill down-home vibe at night. I love the outdoor tables and the big communal table in the back.

My favorite, though, is that they make me one of the best breakfast bagels in the city. It's not on the menu, although all the ingredients are. It's a sesame bagel with egg, fontina, and basil. Order a Hoodie special, lets see if we can get it on the menu full-time. ;)
author: Mike L.

description: Had a Sight Glass espresso and an apricot pop tart made in house.  Both were very nice.  The coffee was pretty balanced, light to medium bodied....and overall pretty good job by the barista.  The space is a neighborhood feel, not overly pretentious and mostly locals from the NOPA area.  A good comfy spot.
author: Porca M.

description:
I really really really wanted to give this place 5 stars.

Let me start by saying they make excellent coffee. Every cup I have had has been enjoyable and it does not hurt that they sell and use Sightglass beans. They also have a nice selection of pastries.

There are also some nice beers on tap.

The only downside is that the space feels a little awkward to me. It just does not feel suited for conversation or reading which is my usual reason for stopping in a cafe for a beer or coffee. There are not comfortable places to sit for any length. It seems like the seats are designed for short stays.

I do highly recommend this place for anybody looking for nice coffee or beer.
author: Eric G.

description:
Hands down, the nicest people in the coffee business. I love these guys! They have been serving me the best latte in town since I opened my business across the corner from them, and every day, I thank my lucky stars that they're my neighbors. Their sandwiches are utterly delicious- I am constantly torn between the salami on baguette or the melted mozzarella and tomato.

Seriously, everyone that works here is a gem and everything they make is delicious. I'm a fan!
author: Demetra D.

description:
This is my new local coffee shop, and it's run by a guy who is also a local and lives near by. He has a real passion for coffee, and as such if you're expecting a Starbucks like experience just get back in your car and head to one. 

As with some traditional coffee shops, they take their time to make all their drinks "correctly", or in a traditional fashion. Your latte will get made with real milk, and it's slow steamed one cup at a time (not in a big bucket like at Starbucks, which is how they can make 20 at a time). It's then slow poured over the espresso shots (every drink comes as a double) until you get that pretty leaf  appearance on the top. Again, like any traditional coffee place does.

They use very good beans and their expresso is super smooth in any of the drinks I've had their. And like Blue Bottle, the make each cup of regular coffee via a manual drip system, one cup at a time. Again, it's not the fastest cup of coffee in the world, but this isn't that kind of place either.

They also have some hot breakfast foods there now too, like bagels with egg and stuff on it, in addition to the pastries they already had. They are also adding more beers as well with the installation of some beer taps. I think they have like 5-6 beers on tap now, in addition to whatever they have in bottles.

Over all if you're looking for a GOOD cup of coffee and you're a fan of these kinds of places, go check it out. I'd put them on par with any of the good coffee joints here in SF.
author: Erik B.

description: No free or even reduced price refills on the already too expensive drip coffee.
author: Jonathan R.

description:
Sure, Blue Bottle is amazing and technically a bit better coffee, especially if you like strong coffee. I like to go to the Blue Bottle in the Mint Plaza, but there is always a line and it is out of the way.

Matching Half for me is also out of my way, it is a destination location. But, I know a lot of people in there are local to the neighborhood which is why I love it. I love to experience the different neighborhoods and what they have to offer. To me, this coffee shop is the best of that and the best of a true coffee shop experience.

Decor = unique, eclectic and fun
Latte = my favorite thing to get here
People = very friendly and interesting
Staff = very nice and actually care
Music = hand-picked by staff

The overall experience is much better than Blue Bottle.
author: Deseray T.

description: I met up with a friend in the area on a Saturday afternoon and needed to do some work after, so I yelped cafe's and came here on a whim. I'm so glad that I did! Maybe it's too early to write a review since I only ordered a peach ginger tea and haven't tried any of their foods or baked goods (they had muffins, a variety of sweet & savory empanadas, cookies, & maybe a few other things but I forgot), but I think if I lived nearby this would definitely be my favorite spot to spend a few relaxing hours doing work, journaling, reading, or hanging out with a friend... I loved the chill (but not drab at all) vibe and it has lots of big windows so it's really nice to come on a bright sunny day. They serve Sightglass coffee also! And parking is pretty easy (always a huge plus, especially in SF!). The people who work there are super nice too :)
author: C K.

description:
Met a friend here to do some serious work on our MSW research projects. I'd never been to this little corner, and I was really pleasantly surprised.

They brew your coffee by the cup -- nice touch. However, it's that flowery, light, Ritual-style coffee, which isn't my favorite. I need something more BOLD.

The music playing could have been my iTunes library on shuffle, with even some obscure artists represented, so that made me feel right at home.

The clientele and staff were a bit scenestery, but not overtly smug, so I was okay with it.

Overall, a nice airy atmosphere and a good place to camp out and do some reading or writing.
author: Megan D.

description: What a great neighborhood cafe. Good coffee (Sight Glass), friendly service, and solid food. Today I had the breakfast sandwich and croissant, both of which were average (3 stars). +1 star though for being an awesome hangout spot (seating at the bar, outside, and airy/sunny from all the windows).
author: Pria P.

description:
I got a mocha, and it's wonderful!  Delightful!  Superb!  I'm sipping it as I type and the world's feeling like a lovely place.  Ahhhh, coffee.

This is the first coffee place I've gone to since moving into my new apartment in SF (though not the first SF coffee place I've been to in general), because it's only about a block and a half from my place...and I couldn't be happier.  This is the kind of coffee I'll be excited to grab every morning before heading to my MUNI stop.  

To give you a sense of the prices -- a latte's $3.25, a mocha's $3.50.  Drip coffee's $2.  

I'm looking forward to trying their other drinks, and their food selection at some point.  I just couldn't hold myself back from an immediate yelp for this stellar mocha!  (FYI, the coffee drinks on the menu are what they've got -- no flavor shots and such-like...which is cool with me, but I'm putting it out there in case you're a vanilla-latte-only type of person, or something like that.)

They were under-staffed for a holiday, but you wouldn't have known it by wait time -- they got my drink to me quickly.  And even so, the guy who took my order and made my drink apologized to me for their being busy/under-staffed!  He and his co-worker were entirely friendly, super polite, ready to help.

The place feels cosy and warm, perhaps due partly to the blond wood and quality of light streaming in -- it had a golden quality to it, really attractive and pleasant.  I was sad to be on a schedule, and I look forward to heading over there when I have time to hang out.
author: Crys L.

description: I love a lot of things like my new Nike shoes and my baby and my dog but today I think the homemade Oreos here are best.
author: Today Y.

description:
I think if I were to ever open a cafe it would be exactly like Matching Half.  This little place has great decor, the music isn't too loud, and the coffee is delicious.  I haven't tried the food, but I have my eye on blue cheese sandwich.  Only problem I have is this place is too popular and it can be hard to get a seat sometimes.

Outdoor seating for nice weather.
author: Rachel R.

description:
So I live a block away from this place. I've stopped in a couple times before hopping on the bus to get to work and the interior and set up is really nice and it's convenient it's so close to my place. However, I've gotten the same barista the two times I've been in here and can I say friendliness isn't her strong point. No smile, no friendly greeting...just a blank stare and  "what can I get you?". OK, I get it's early and maybe you're not a morning person but you work in a cafe. Drink some coffee. Would it hurt you to be a little nice to your customers? Maybe she just has a bland and dry personality. I'l go back in to find out but three strikes you're out dude!

Coffee is ok. Double latte comes in a tiny cup which looks like it's meant more for an Americano. Sorry, I like my double lattes in a big cup, not a tiny one. I haven't tried any other coffees but after that tiny little double latte I think I'll switch it up next time to see what's different.

I haven't tried the food so this review is only for coffee and service.
author: David C.

description:
I like the minimalist, no-fuss, no-clutter nature of this cafe. It's atmosphere makes me feel clean and refreshed, with all the plants, nice dishware and open windows.

It's almost one of those zero-outlet establishments which would put it on my black list (as I'm an avid cafe computer user), but there's one outlet below the coffee station where you could get your charge on.
author: Valerie L.

description:
Great blue-bottle based cafe in NoPa, with a slayer machine.

Also sell beer and wine!
author: Alun E.

description:
Cappuccino: 4-star (not perfect)
Music:  5-star(not too loud)
Service: 5-star
Internet: 5-star (fast enough)
Atmosphere: 5-star
Temperature: 5-star
Brightness: 5-star (has large windows)
Table: 5-star
Cleanness: 5-star
Bathroom: 5-star (very clean)
author: Yosuke K.

description:
This is the kind of place I'm looking to patronize regularly ... and I will!

The people are awesome, the atmosphere is very comfortable and they just got their liquor license! So I can easily see myself grabbing a few beers at a Saturday night and then coming back in on Sunday morning to read my paper and have a fabulous latte and pastry. 

Talk about latte art, the baristas are true artists. Definitely worth a try once, twice - or everyday if you're like me.
author: Sho B.

description:
I'm new to this neighborhood and go it for a quick lunch before work.  I order a latte, turkey sandwich with a side salad for a total of about 13.00 and change.  Not cheap but for the city in a small cafe its about average.  My latte comes in what we used to refer to as a tea cup.  Its beautiful and hot but way to strong for me.   I go to the counter and ask  them to transfer into a coffee cup and add more milk.   The manager tells me they can't do that.  They have agreed to sell only one size of latte.  I ask again, please pour it into a coffee cup and add some more milk.  I have a gastric issue and it will only cause me pain about 20 minutes after drinking it.   He says they that they can't do that.  He offered to pull me a short shot (in the same sort of cup) and it will have more milk.  I don't want that.  I want all the caffeine but I want it diluted.   He absolutely refused.. I reminded him I am the customer and he said, yes, I AM the customer but they will not sell a latte in a bigger cup.   I offered to pay for the extra milk.  Again, they refuse to sell a latte in a larger cup.    OK folks, is it me????  I told him that I would not  be coming back and I wanted a refund on my coffee.  Instead of keeping a customer he still refused to transfer my latte into a larger cup and gave me a refund on my latte.    I work for a very large retail store, customer service is the top most importance.  We've had to do some stupid things because our customs were demanding.  Nothing that cost a lot of money for the store but its hard to let the customer get one over one you. Especially when you both know they are.   In this case I was not.  I just wanted a bit more milk in my latte.

This guy is good at what he does and never raised his voice or became rude.  I appreciate that.  The sandwich was very good and the side salad was worth the money.   I think their espresso might even be very good too.    

The young man who was my server was also very sweet and offered to get me something else to drink and apologized for the inconvenience.  All in all it would have been an excellent review if not for their silly customer service issues.

Still, I won't be coming back.  There are many more little business out there that want my business are are willing to take care of my small requests because they realize that every customer is different and often one must be flexible to keep their business growing.
author: Stephanie G.

description: Much needed decent independent coffee joint in NOPA hood. They have a very nice Slayer espresso machine with creates amazing shots. Staff is very unassuming and cool. The logo on their outdoor sign is a bit hard to read, i admit. Great work and addition to the neighborhood, MH!
author: casey c.

description: A quieter alternative to the rush on Divis. Great place to get work done. Also, the turkey sandwich and Oreos are pretty phenomenal.
author: Ashna C.

description: Gave Matching Half Café another chance. Staff is as nice as ever. But this time the WiFi didn't work. They said their router had been malfunctioning and that they probably need to get a new one. I am out of luck with this place.
author: Guillermo G.

description: Delicious, 3rd wave coffee. Free Wi-Fi. Notable pastries (their homemade poptarts are not made by them but they rock). Didn't give 5 stars because of their lackluster sandwiches, and sometimes there's a hint of an attitude in the otherwise friendly staff.
author: Nikolas B.

description:
love, love, love this place to grab a cupcake/scone/etc and a cappuccino.
Perfect little place to go to with your books or a friend to chit-chat.
author: farzana k.

description:
I'm happy to see someone read their yelp reviews! 

I tried Matching Half again last night and was very happy to see a nicer staff that promptly greeted my group, a fully stocked kitchen and great wine specials!! 

I had the turkey sandwich, it was tasty but nothing special. The salad on the side was a little boring. Basically just romaine with dressing. However, everyone enjoyed their wine and the happy hour prices were good. They also have a few good beers. I think this is a good spot for happy hour or coffee & pastries. 

Overall it's a nice, clean location...a welcome addition to the hood!

p.s. they should think about changing their sign. As one reviewer said, it would probably look great on a business card, but it just doesn't look good on a sign.
author: Kandace K.

description:
Hooray, finally a cafe in this neighborhood that serves high quality coffee with friendly service. No attitude, you ask? Am I in Oz? Must I return with the Witch's slippers? You needn't wake yourself up, these lovely people have realized that you don't need to be a-holes in order to serve coffee, even in this town and even in Nopa. The coffee is quite good and the baristas are on top of their game. Yes, a bit of a learning curve but I've been in 3 times over the past week and each time the service improved.

A lot of the negative reviews seem to be from people who have no patience at all for a brand new cafe working out the kinks. Give them a break, jeez. You don't like it? Go back to the coffee butchers over at Mojo who, after a few years in business, have no clue how to make a decent cappuccino. I'm pretty sure they're too busy admiring their tattoos to care. 

Welcome to the neighborhood, Matching Half. It's great to have you.
author: Pamela S.

description:
The coffee here is pretty good, the atmosphere is pleasant and it's a great addition to the neighborhood. 

The so so review is because of the major inconsistencies with the coffee and the sizes. The coffee taste varies each time and sometimes when I order a Latte it comes in a large cup and sometimes in a small. I usually order the drip and ask the counter person for the strongest beans, although this has varied too. 

All and all, if you're in the hood this place is worth checking out. The kicker for me (and the reason I am taking a break) is because there is a petite woman who seems to be working or "lingering" every time I go. She might be the owner (not positive) but she is unbelievably unpleasant. She has sucked the energy right out of me on several occasions, which is the last thing you want when you haven't had coffee or started your day yet. I could name several examples but I'll just leave it at that and hope things get better. The other folks that work there are very friendly!
author: Kara S.

description:
I live down the street and have been here 4 times to give this cute independantly owned coffee shop a(nother) chance... 

  Sadly, EVERY time I have been in, the customer service has SUCKED! Look, thier coffee is good, but not as much as all of the other small batch coffee houses sprawling our city. 
  Blue Bottle, Ritual, Four Barrel... Better coffee, with no lame ass attitude problems! 
 Sorry folks, but your grumpy barristas and amateur customer service have me hitting up those better spots in the city.
author: Danielle L.

description:
Friendly if somewhat bland caffeine and wine destination.

Have no complaints about the service - very accommodating, warm and genuine. They customized both my sandwiches (ham for turkey, add lettuce, pears instead of cheese, etc.) without extra charge. Unfortunately egg whites aren't an option, and they missed my request for no dressing on one of them. Prices slightly high for the size.

All was consumed in a clean, nondescript atmosphere. Free wifi, but there is currently only one working outlet. I'm glad no one tripped over my cord.

I left satisfied but with little to recommend.
author: Jason B.

description: Nice, low key coffee shop/cafe. Friendly staff, good food and usually not too crowded during the weekdays. Not particularly cheap though that is offset a little by the nice environment if you want to sit and work for an hour or two. Don't come here if you are in a hurry though; everything moves VERY slowly! Also, it's a bit over the top hipster... oh well.
author: A Z.

description:
FINALLY... Excellent coffee in my hood!!! Can't beat fresh ground Verve* (soon to be Sightglass**!) w/ miro-filtered water running though either a Slayer*** for a perfect Macchiato ($2.50) or their handcrafted single origin drips ($2). Hands down the best crafted coffee west of 315 Linden Alley. 

Bonus: The young owners, that have invested a lot of love and energy into their dream and created something quite special, couldn't be more humble, sweet and real.

* * http://vervecoffeeroasters.myshopify.com/pages/about
* ** http://twitter.com/sightglass
* *** http://www.slayerespresso.com

Drinking Suggestions: 

1.With Espresso, less is more and milk is for babies, so if you're into Lattés, try graduating to a Cappuccino.
2. With Single Origin, try no milk or sugar. It'll open you up the distinct, rich, and unique flavors of Latin America, Africa, and Indonesia. 
3. Make time to enjoy your drink out of glass or ceramic (paper cups taste like...well... paper, compromising a clean uncontaminated taste) 
4. Finally, don't get in a fit about "it's not hot enough." Most places overheat milk, killing all notes (i.e. grassy, honey, etc.) and sweetness, resulting in a scalded/sour taste. 

P.S. To the entitled, self-important, egotistical yelp haters with no patience and an expectance for phony appeasement and jumbo syrup drinks, It's easy to destroy rather then create, isn't it?
author: Engelbert H.

description:
This has rapidly become my favorite coffee place in the neighborhood. Without a doubt they mke the best cup of 'Joe in the 'hood and everyone who works here is super nice. Jason and his staff really create a nice, friendly environment and the cafe is well lit and comfortable. The sandwiches are well done and all in all they do a great job. 

I'd go here every day, but, as with many drip coffee places, sometimes you have to wait. Not that this is the end-of-the-world, but if I'm in a hurry I still go to Cafe Abir. Also the bagel making speed here is Herculean in its lethargy, but these are small complaints for an overall terrific spot.

Doesn't get five stars because I have to be subjected to the horrendous sounds of reggae once a week...I'd rather listen to the death-rattle of my only child than reggae.
author: brant f.

description:
Matching Half is a good, hidden little neighborhood coffee shop, although it can get quite packed on the weekends and they have been known to run out of most of the food on their menu by mid-afternoon.

The coffee is good though, as are most of the salads and sandwiches. Also, I seem to have a certain weakness for the homemade pop tarts...
author: Brian D.

description: A friend of mine who lives in the neighborhood suggested that I check this place out. It's an awesome little cafe. They have free wifi and a simple menu. I ordered an apple and goat cheese baguette with some hand drip coffee. Both were tasty. I was also able to try some of their handmade oreos, which I never seen before, and homemade pop tarts. I'll be sure to stop by this place if I'm in the area again. Nice neighborhood cafe.
author: Frances V.

description:
Definitely the best latte in the city. Not to mention the best little muffin things that are just the perfect size leaving you satiated without the gross-i-ate-too-much feeling.

Added bonus, the large table in the back, which is perfect for board games with friends.

Just wish I was still living 1 block away.
author: Jane H.

description: Best coffee shop in the neighborhood. Only downside is that I never make coffee for myself because this place is conveniently next door.
author: Brendan P.

description:
The idea behind Matching Half is pretty cool... you no longer need to decide whether you want to go to a place with coffee, a bar for beer, or a wine bar.  Now, you can go to a place that does all three well.

Matching Half has its soft opening this week, and it seems like a pretty cool place.  There's a bar on one side where you order your drinks and a line of tables on the other side.  The decor is simple, yet stylish, and they have wifi available.

I need to go once they have their beer & wine license and get the kinks worked out, but for now I give it 3 stars.

H as free wifi internet available for customers
A lcohol or caffeine... you decide!
L ocated in the Western Addition at McAllister & Baker St
F ind room at the communal table in the back or take a seat at the bar
author: Kenny L.

description: I absolutely love this cafe. They always provide water for my dog when I bring her by and their pop tarts are delicious. It's a great spot to sit and read or meet up with someone for lunch/coffee. Their turkey sandwich is really bomb too! I love the atmosphere of the place and the pictures that they change on the walls are always interesting and fun to look at. Keep it up guys!
author: Rachel T.

description:
I'm here almost every day when I'm in SF. The coffee is great and the people are friendly. I love that it seems halfway between a coffee shop an a friendly bar. Great beers are always on tap, with pints at only $4 during happy hour. The food is good for light meals, and is always fresh and well-prepared. 

The only bad part is when all of you other people show up, and I can't get a table ;)
author: Mr S.

description: Good place, pretty decent coffees, great Customer service, great design, great food....all in all, it's pretty tight
author: Joshua D.

description:
The Matching Half Cafe is the kind of cafe San Francisco can always use more of.  It's local, fresh, well-lit, and clearly cared for.  I've had more than a beer or two while saddled up to the bar, chatting with friends, and relaxing in the chill atmosphere.  The real measure of a new restaurant-cum-cafe is whether i'd want to spend another couple hours there, and with the Matching Half, I can resolutely say "yes" to the great service, great drinks, and relaxed vibe.  

good times!
author: Jacob M.

description:
Dear Matching Half,

Until today, you were my among my favorite cafes.  Pleasant staff, great lunch food, good music, a big table to work at, and *excellent coffee*  - overall, a good place to park my butt for a couple of hours in the midst of my workday. 

MH, I don't know what happened, but the past couple of cups I've gotten from you guys have been abysmal.  Brown water, with none of the rounded bitterness that brings a tingle to my mouth in the morning. 

I'm sad - what happened?  How did you guys go south so quickly and dramatically?
author: Becka R.

description:
This cafe is adorable and makes me wish that I lived in the neighborhood!

I had the chamomile tea and the Pear and Fontina sandwich with a fig chutney.

The chamomile tea came in a lovely little pot and was excellent (loose leaf tea).

The sandwich was good, although I wished the pear had been paired with a stronger cheese, since I found that the sweetness over-powered the savory in the sandwich. I think this is a personal preference thing though.

The space is especially lovely, definitely stop by if you are ever in the neighborhood!
author: Cindy C.

description:
I absolutely love this place.  Friendly staff, -great- food, and a pleasant, neighborhood vibe.  It is an inviting atmosphere.

Be on the lookout for: chocolate chip cookies with sea salt sprinkled on top, the kale salad, and their bagels.  The bagels they serve are reminiscent of east coast bagels,  but are a little lighter and less malty.  It is a nice balance.

The live music shows they occasionally put on are always fun, and they make an effort to have interesting art on the wall.  It isn't always to my taste, but it at least has artistic merit.
author: Aaron L.

description:
I remember this place when it was a run down, and then boarded up, coffee joint a few years ago. So I was pleasantly surprised to roll by the other day and see a new, fresh and bright cafe in it's place. 

Sunday I decided to take a leisurely stroll and check the place out. It being warmer and sunnier (somewhat) than the last few weeks I thought an iced latte sounded just about right.

Upon ordering said latte I was told I couldn't have it. I figured their ice machine hadn't been installed yet and was offered a chilled coffee. I agreed and my barista proceeded to fill a glass with ice and cold coffee?
Um, why couldn't I have an iced latte, I inquired. "We don't pour our espresso over ice, it shocks it... We take our coffee very seriously" was his answer.

Really guys.. really? You're gonna open a cafe and tell customers how they can and can't have their coffee. I mean, I'm a bit of a coffee snob too but come on, really?

To my further dismay the iced coffee I did get was kinda bland and now the staff just seemed to dislike me. Apparently I had done something wrong.

Oh well, not my matching half i guess. I'll stick with Velo Rouge and their strong ass, delicious iced lattes and super chill staff.
author: Scott W.

description: Ah yes, my cute little neighborhood coffee shop. The staff is super friendly and the patrons seems to be folks around the hood, which gives it that homey feel. I love the art (many of it from neighbor Workshop). They also have live music sometimes in the evenings. Their bagels and morning goods are tasty and while I don't love the drip Sightglass coffee (gasp), the lattes are great.
author: Emilia S.

description:
This place is a bright spot in a cool little four-corner commercial/residential area.

The view is sweet, big windows - you can watch morning waves of people heading to the bus stop. Also, there is always an art collection hanging on the wall inside.  

As for the food and drinks, it's all pretty much right on.  Well worth a visit.
author: Todd S.

description:
Happy to have a nice coffee house/wine spot with outdoor seating close to the crib.

It's beautifully designed and has a very peaceful vibe that blends well with the neighborhood. 

I thought it was really pricey for what I ordered - $3.25 for a standard no frills latte in a teeny little to-go cup. The coffee was on par with other local coffee shops, but not exceptional - so I felt a little jipped on the price. (I could have walked 2 blocks further Central Cafe and gotten a latte twice the size with a little shot of vanilla for the same price)

We went at 9am on a weekday, it was full inside, but not packed and  it took about 10 mins. to get two lattes to go - i'm sure this is a "working out the kinks" thing.

I'll definitely give them another go in a few weeks once they get rolling and figure out the swing of things. They seemed a bit disorganized and stressed out today - but I'm really glad to see them in the neighborhood.. 

I'll be back in a few weeks and really hope to up my review rating - I hope they get it all worked out and succeed-  as small businesses like Matching Half built right into the residential areas are great for our neighborhood.
author: Melissa J.

description:
Probably the best coffee I know of 5 blocks in any direction of the place, its a really well set up small space, and its right across the street from Green Chile Kitchen which is one of my favorite mexican places in the area.

They's cash only, which can be a bit annoying but its really good overall, I usually get the Mocha or the Cappuccino.
author: Abhinav S.

description: I only live half a block away & I've been there two times already. I love the look of the cafe and the owl logo. The coffee is good but it's just not hot enough. Coffee should = hot. First time just tried the drip for $2 just lukewarm. Just tried the premium for $3 which they drip on the spot. Almost cold-how could that be?! I like my coffee damn hot-almost burn your mouth hot. And for $3 bucks, I want that! Is that it too much to ask? I'll still go back but I expect a HOT cup!
author: Karen C.

description: I love this place. I live nearby and have tons of options as far as coffee shops - this place is by far my fav. The staff is super nice and the chocolate croisants are da bomb. The granolla, yogurt, honey, and fresh fruit is always a tasty A.M. snack as well. Only complaint would be that there doesn't seem to be and outlets that work to plug your laptop in! Still, could never knock this place a star based on that. I'll be back tomorrow =}
author: Douglas S.

description: Update: Matching Half now accepts credit cards!!! BuhBYE bajillion dollar ATM fee!! Lalalove it.
author: Kacie H.

description:
There are a few other cafes closer to my apartment, but I'll willingly walk with heavy computer and everything to get a seat here. It's beautiful inside, with nice wooden tables, lots of windows, and cool art on the walls that seems to change regularly. It seems like the owner and employees care a lot about the cafe and work hard to keep everything top notch.

I usually get just plain coffee, which is rich and not at all bitter, although sometimes I spring for the cappuccino. Espresso drinks are smaller than some might like, but they're so delicious it's worth it (think Blue Bottle style). The food is good too. I especially like the turkey sandwich, and the fruit and granola for breakfast time. 

They have free WiFi too (but only one plug, and it's not close to most of the tables). Basically everything about this place is great. You can sit and study, eat good food, and they have beer and wine, outside seating, and they played all the World Cup games. Absolutely no reason not to go.
author: Tonya N.

description: Fantastic local coffee shop, great food, try the Kale salad!  Im headed there now for a latte!
author: Trent S.

description: The Hipster Laptop Mafia rules here, and too often there's no available seating. Single iPad drones camp out for interminable periods at tables for two, using it as a public library or a means of escaping their terrible roommates or depressing apartments. Sitting outside, an option, is hardly practical in most weather.
author: Scott S.

description:
Happy to finally be able to get a decent cappuccino within walking distance of home. That's a huge deal, but boy is it annoying to deal with the people there. It's like some random friends got together, bought a really fancy espresso machine, and opened a shop.  They are slow and unprofessional. It lacks the smooth speed of a legit coffee house.

If they got a little more on top of things, and used organic beans and milk, I'd be a much happier camper. But since there is zero competition in the neighborhood, I'll be back most weekends.
author: Lauren H.

description: Nice joint. Very helpful baristas, and the coffee is made strong. The pop tarts are also extremely tasty.
author: C D.

description:
simply put this place has the best coffee in the western Addition/NoPa area. i love the two dollar PBRs as well. the people are friendly and unpretentious. i live near by and wander in at least once or twice a day. the only downside could be all the tables being hogged by the laptops and everyone who thinks all they should have to pay for an office is the price of a 2.5 dollar latte. great sunny (afternoon) outdoor seating as well. 
one of my favorite spots hands down.
author: nate c.

description: A small neighborhood cafe. GREAT Macchiato but only when pretty, female barista makes: Don'noh why... Drip coffee is too weak for me. Gimmie a strong, flavorful shot to make my day!
author: Yoshiko M.

description: over-priced cafe near Baker St., has Izze soft drinks.
author: Denise C.

description: This place is a gem.  I can get great coffee or beer, depending on the mood and the time of day.  This place has a great feel and really good light.  People watching is good too.
author: Tom D.

description: I would love to inform all that MH now takes credit cards, thanks to the amazing technology that is Square. Yay!
author: Brodie J.

description: I've noticed the quality of the coffee here starting to slip, a shame since they charge a premium for it.  Your safest bet is to get an Americano which always delivers.  The staff is friendly and they make some delicious food items.  There usually isn't enough seating with all of the Macbook owners camping out and it's too cold and windy to sit outside.  The rotating artwork keeps this place looking fresh and hip but it does feel like a scene sometimes.
author: N E.

description: First, best drip coffee in the city.  Totally addictive.  I've been to four barrel, blue bottle, etc, etc, and these guys just do it better.  Excellent location, too, with plenty of outdoor seating in a quiet and sometimes sunny location.  Friendly baristas.  Free wifi.  Good food.  So glad these guys are in the hood.
author: Rob E.

description: Cool, alternative feel. I like it. (Be sure to walk there, no parking)
author: Sean H.

description: Homemade poptarts are overrated. The service was so-so. Coffee was decent...I had the breakfast sandwich which also was ok (not anything I would drive back into the city for). It;s a decent place to get coffee if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Elaine K.

description: Finally, something other than Starbucks within a 2 block radius. Every single cup I've had from them has been perfect. I love the brightness of the cafe and the quality of their beans. I get Sightglass from them every once in awhile for the home brew. On lighter days, we've brought boardgames to the back table. Perfect size for Galaxy Truckers. Pair that up with 2-3 cups of coffee on a rainy day and call it perfect.
author: Jacinta H.

description: Fantastic place. I love that it's so close to USF. The espresso is tasty and bright: citrus notes, with a medium roast flavor.  They offer pastries and a great sandwich selection. Definitely visit this place. I hope they can keep the campers out while school in session.
author: Ron S.

description:
Wow.  I have rarely been compelled to immediately write a review (I'm actually still here...).  First of all - great coffee and awesome selection of pastries from Blackjet Bakers (so freaking good).  More importantly - the service is incredible.

There is only one working outlet (which is why I took off the star), but they pointed me right there and helped me get my stuff out of the way and let me set up and work.  As soon as I sat down, I spilled my drink ... classic.  Let me be clear, I spilled it.  I didn't get knocked over, it was 100% my fault.  They immediately came with towels and helped me clean it up, and all the while made me a new drink.  

I know this may seem like the right thing to do, but there are so many snobby places lately that this common courtesy really goes a long way.  I will absolutely be back here for the ambiance, the coffee and snacks, and the people.

P.S. - THEY PLAY AMAZING MUSIC!
author: Josh L.

description:
This place either serves INSANE coffee or water as hell coffee.
I was really psyched on a new coffee spot opening right on the corner of my street and when I went to try it out I was SUPER bummed.  It looks snobby inside, and you'll probably not be greeted by the staff because they are sort of snobby too.  The first time I went, i ordered a cofee to go.  That's IT.  15 minutes later, i had a cup of coffee in a small paper cup.  It was super hot and they don't have any of those sleeves to protect your hands.  They didn't appologize that it took that long for a cup of coffee.  I could have easily walked to the supermarket, and brewed my own in half that time.  But instead i paid 2 dollars for a small cup of insane coffee.  It was very strong and thus, made me insane.

I wanted to give them a chance to redeem themselves, so I returned a week later with my boyfriend.  The service was a bit friendlier.  Boyfriend ordered an egg and cheese on a bagel, they only had 2 options for bagels.  We also ordered 2 coffees to go, and low and behold, the bagel w/egg and cheese was ready a good 10 minutes before our coffees.
Also, how can you have fancy coffee and no sugar that doesn't come in a packet?

Step it up, matching half, this neighborhood expects better from you.
author: Alexandra A.

description:
Near perfect--great staff, amazing coffee, beautiful space.  And, outdoor seating is well-needed in the area.

Only knock: $2 coffee refills.  It's a bit much.

They disconnected their power outlets so that laptop users won't camp out.  Great if you're just a patron, bad if you're going there to work.
author: david m.

description: I have been going here since they opened. It is hands down one of my favorite spots to get coffee and snacks in SF. The food is always good. I love the breakfast sandwiches, I always opt for avocado rather than ham on mine, but either way, they are great! They serve Sight Glass coffee, I like getting a cap and they always make it well!
author: Daniel K.

description:
Great products here, but what's the use if you can't enjoy them!
The gal preparing my bagel, literally stared at the toaster waiting for it.
How bout, maybe... wash your hands?!!!
And not continuously running your fingers through your hair, or wiping your mouth, or fidgeting with your cloths!
Then proceeding to mindlessly spin and spread, spin and spread, spin and spread, spin and spread...get the picture? Stop. You've already touched the bagel bout 30 times!
There's no excuse. You need to except that you are a food handler. And with it comes responsibility. 
Don't run your fingers through your hair or across your mouth ever!
And if you do, stop and wash your hands immediately. And spreading a bagel requires about two swipes. 
And if you're asking yourself, why does this all matter?
Then there's the problem...
author: Ame W.

description:
Tasty food, great customer service, but...

Coffee used to be hefty-hefty-hefty but is now WIMPY-WIMPY-WIMPY!  Pls fix thx.
author: a s.

description:
Back for a second review. 

I still love coming here. The music, the coffee, the food; all of it is excellent. I understand that some people are less than pleased with the number of outlets. However, let me broach the topic like this. Would you rather be able to sit in here for 2-3 hours(of battery life) and enjoy a sandwich, pastry or espresso; or would you rather not be able to take a set at all because the 6 early birds have been camped out for hours on end with an endless power supply.

The Food:
I am always skeptical of new food places, part of being OCD. However, I did have a tomato, moz and basil sandwich there a few weeks ago and fell in love, I now have one at least twice a week. Same goes with the breakfast sandwich. Add a little tomato and it's perfect. Throw that fucker on a croissant and POW!

Verdict on appeal:
Still one of my favorite places to spend an afternoon. Start of with a sandwich and espresso. Finish off the experience with a few beers as I read the paper and all of the sudden the news ain't so depressing. And look at that it stopped raining as I put a period on this review.
author: Jackson D.

description:
Nice addition to the neighborhood.  Great capuccino, great snacks.  A little pricey but worth it.

Although... about a year ago they made alot of noise about how they intended to buy a Surly Big Dummy or some similar hipster El Camino so that they could go greener and localer.  They staged an advertising campaign to drive business to raise money for it, and got the local bike crowd to urge customers in - but as far as I can tell they're Dummy-less.
author: peter s.

description: What a pleasant surprise!!! My husband + dog came here for lunch on Sunday and we were greeted by a very friendly staff. I ordered the ham/cheese/tomato panini and it was DELISH.  Perfectly thin ham, melted cheese, and the bread was oh so soft!  We enjoyed their tables outside out front, and the staff even brings you your food when its ready.  Im so happy this place is in my hood! Ill be coming here weekly :)
author: Veronica P.

description:
COFFEE SHOP SNOBBERY 101---I really wanted to like this spot because of it's location. Sunny outdoor seating and a clean indoor appearance makes matching half appealing, BUT more important is a quality product and customer service both of which are lacking here. They serve a Latte in a 8oz to-go cup, better know as an 'Africano' because they believe this to be the benchmark for proportions and something that sets them apart from the multitude of coffee shops in the area. Normally this would be fine because if you wanted you could ask for a larger cup and that is what you would get. Not at Matching half though! They believe so strongly in their idealistic proportion rule that they are willing to have an argument over it thus losing valuable business over a silly principle. Believe me I have tested them on many occasion in hopes they would step up and understand how to properly serve the needs and wishes of their customers only to be met with arrogance or some stupid excuse like 'the larger cup doesn't fit' or 'our milk steamer can is the size of a thimble' or 'we take our coffee seriously and that isn't how you are supposed to have it' or 'we've run out of larger cups' when you can see them behind the incompetent barista who on average takes somewhere between 10 and 15 minutes minimum to make your drink. Cutting off the nose to spite ones face it seems and far from making friends. 

Coffee shop snobbery and an establishment which offends it's customers with it's overt incompetence is not where i would choose to spend my daily 4 dollars and would advise others to think twice about supporting this place. They are rude and defensive purveyors of marginally decent coffee that pales in comparison to Mojo, Ritual, Blue bottle, Apollo, and Cafe Abir which is just around the corner. Remember Matching half people...without the support of your local community you have nothing.

PS let us all remember as well that out of the 51 or so reviews the lion share come from friends and relatives of the owners. For a place that displays such high levels of SUCK i can't imagine that there are 50+ people out there who honestly like POOR service and are willing to overlook fundamental flaws in every aspect of this type of small business. Listen to the real people who spent the time writing and not the bubbly rants of blind loyalists.
author: Trevor M.

description: Still love the coffee, the internet connection and the vibe but finding out today that there are pretty much NO power outlets. There are 3 along the back wall all with a little sticker on them that say "No Power", can't find any others either. Grrr... this is kinda an important thing for a cafe to have, right?
author: Rachael B.

description: Very nice space and decor, and equipped with a Slayer espresso machine, like Sightglass.  And, like Sightglass, the Slayer-made espressos can be a bit inconsistent, and occasionally on the acidic side.  That said, they've never been less than very good, and the people are very friendly.  On my WinXP laptop, I haven't consistently connected to their wi-fi network, but my iPhone does, so I can't hold that against them. :-)
author: Ari M.

description: love this little corner coffee shop. yummy breakfast sandwiches, addictive yogurt + granola + fruit bowl, and tasty cappuccinos. lovely ambiance and friendly staff. one of my favorites.
author: Jane L.

description: Latte is too small and not hot enough. They need to crank the temp up and offer more than 1 size. Great location across from Green Chili.
author: Shawn L.

description: I've known Lauren since jr. high, and she's always had impeccable taste. While everyone else went through their awkward phase, she just oozed style and class, so when I finally meandered over to her new cafe, Matching Half, I wasn't surprised at how awesome it looked. She and long time boyfriend Jason hand made the tables and bar and they're so sleek and sophisticated. The chairs were modern and comfortable too, and the glasswear is gorgeous and displayed tastefully. The menu is smart and simple, and done really well. My fav is the breakfast special - for somewhere around 6-8 bucks (my bad for not paying complete attention to the price) you can score a delicious breakfast egg sandwich on brioche and a PBR. For a dollar more you can move it on up in the world and get a mimosa to replace the beer.  My kind of deal.
author: Amber K.

description:
I would really like to recommend this cafe, especially because in theory it's an excellent addition to the neighborhood.  After another bad experience, however, I'm avoiding it and keeping my fingers crossed that the owners either hire someone to help them with operational and customer service issues, or figure it out very quickly on their own so they retain their currently enthusiastic clientele.  For now, I recommend you stay away unless you like getting high blood pressure in the morning and have a lot of time to spare so you've got "cushion time" should your order get screwed up - very likely - and need time for a "do over".

The Bad:
-If you handle money, cashier person, DON'T handle food with your dirty hands -- it's gross.
-It's sad that such a beautiful cafe should be filled inside and out with piles of dirty plates, cups, etc.  It was amusing when one of the owners, as she slowly made espresso drinks, kept apologizing that they were out of plates.  Um...get someone to buss and stock.  
-You can't serve coffee and espresso drinks and not have regular sugar.  Not acceptable.  I don't care if you are "out".  No excuses.
-None of the baristas seem to have had any training and this has made for lukewarm drinks and VERY SLOW service.  
-I ordered a wheat bagel with cream cheese at 10:15 a.m., and they were already out of cream cheese, but I wasn't notified until ten minutes after I placed my order.  I was told it would be awhile before they got more.  (How about a quick trip to the convenience store across the street?)  I switched my order to wheat, cheese and egg.  I got a cinnamon raisin with cheese and egg.  After having waited 20 minutes for my food I took a deep breath and notified one of the owners, and he took care of the mistake quickly.  By then I needed it to go, and I was done with my latte.  Mistakes happen, but they've got to be handled quickly.  So far, there is nothing quick about the Matching Half Cafe.
-Admittedly annoying and picky comment:  the font of the sign hanging outside would look great on on a business card...just not on a large sign.  It makes my eyes involuntarily cross every time I look at it.

As someone who has worked in a cafe, I totally get that it can take awhile to work out the kinks -- but the timeframe for getting it right better be a super fast one.  Otherwise the novelty of this beautiful cafe will wear off quickly, no matter the pleasantness of the owners or the quality of coffee.  I already had a couple of great choices for coffee and bagels, and I'm happy to stick to them.

The Good:
-No discernible attitude among the employees.
-Most beautiful cafe bathroom I've ever seen.
-Lots of light inside, and lots of seating outside.
-The promise of a good afternoon/evening spot for beer and wine.
-Nice owners with good intentions.
author: G. B.

description: Was stoked for a nice coffee shop to open up.  The bummer is they can't keep their drip coffee hot.  Thy put it in containers and give it to you on cups that stay lukewarm for 3 minutes.  Everyone In our building had to ditch this place.  We get our coffee at the Mexican place across the street that opens at nine and has lump sugar.  We gave matching half a chance but they never did anything about it.  Bummer.
author: Tim T.

description: Matching Half Cafe is an oasis in a city overrun with chain coffee shops. The couple who started it literally poured their hearts, souls, and sweat into remodeling the venue and it shows! Enjoy a quality espresso drink by day (or brunch with a mimosa added for only a $1!!!) and a glass of wine or beer by night. MHC boasts a clean, modern aesthetic infused with old-fashioned hospitality. Plus, there's the bonus of outdoor seating!
author: M. D.

description: I feel so lucky that I happened to live in the green side area of the city. It's not Central Park, but we have lotsa trees and amazing grass and we have Matching Half Cafe. This cool-feeling corner neighborhood cafe has one of the best Chai Latte that I've ever had. Seriously, I'm not trying to be their spokesperson or anything, but it's delicious. It gives you the chai kick but still gives you enough foam to play the mustache effect with. Matching Half Cafe is becoming one of my favorite place to have my afternoon coffee. The place is spotless. Uh oh..., I should say, I got introduced by Mission Minis Cupcakes from there too. I love this place. Can't you tell? *hint: 5 bright red stars*...
author: Inne S.

description: I love love love this place!! Great, local coffee and snacks, lovely interior, awesome decor and the employees are fucking rad! Everyone that works there is super friendly and aren't pretentious like most folks at great sf coffee shops. Well done ya'll.
author: Liza Z.

description: Tremendous espresso-well made using a really nice blend. This espresso enters Copenhagen Coffee Collective territory. Sugar and milk would only detract.
author: Pope M.

description:
I was super excited when I realized a new cafe was going to open on this corner.  Went to check out this morning and was sorely disappointed.  If you are expecting to get a coffee drink that actually fits your desires, this is not the place for you.  Your options: whole milk or nonfat.  I'm sorry, that is a HUGE difference in taste.  And no offer by the barista to make it blended.  I don't consider myself to be a high maintenance person, but come on, offer up some lowfat!  Plus it was $3.25 for the smallest latte I've ever gotten.  Half the size of a normal small latte.  Definitely not worth the price when it wasn't even really what I wanted to begin with.

I'm all for supporting local business.  But I have no interest in an overpriced, snobby, hipster-esque cafe in the neighborhood.  I'll stick to what's already here.
author: a. w.

description: Absolutely LOVE this place!! My only complaint (which is why I'm only giving it 4 stars instead of 5) is that there are almost no outlets to plug in your laptop so be warned that your limited to your battery life. Otherwise the coffee is oh so good, the staff is great, and the food is yummy!!!
author: Nathan J.

description:
Dean and Deluca Meet the Western Addition

The Matching Half Cafe brings a touch of class to the Western Addition (or if you prefer to NOPA). 
The white interior with subway tiles lining the walls has a Dean and Deluca feel that adds much to this up and coming area of the city. 

The coffee is divine as are the pastries from the Bakers of Paris. 
The staff is a little short handed, but this appears only to be because business is much better than the owners had anticipated. 

The cafe has really taken off. With lines forming outside the door on Saturday  and Sunday

More importantly, the cafe adds another eatery within walking distance of Western Addition/NOPA residents. 

With the opening of the Matching Half Cafe, this revitalized neighborhood has gained a great cup of coffee and a new sense of community in the bargain.
author: Michele F.

description: Cute spot, great coffee, and the cappuccino I dream about...but I don't think I have enough urban outfitters in my life to spend any significant time there...I think I can get over that though.
author: Liz A.

description:
Not my favorite. I go here on occasion because I it is in a convenient location for me. 
The coffee is usually a fruity blend, I tend to like a more earthy roast. 
If you get a coffee "for here" they don't give you any sort of discount if you want a refill. 
The sandwiches and pastries are overpriced.
I will say though, that the service and the atmosphere is very nice.
author: sarah d.

description:
What a great addition to Western Addition.  The espresso drinks alone merit a 5 star rating.  Seriously as good as anything I get at Blue Bottle or Four Barrel.  The fact that it's a cute, light-filled space with nice peaceful views, outdoor seating and good bagels?  Just icing.  Looking forward to many more visits.


@Kandace of prev. review:  If you are afraid of the conv. store on Baker and McAllister, maybe you should move to Walnut Creek.  Just saying.
author: Troy B.

description: Super good.  Very fresh.  Only complaint is no ketchup!  Really?  With a breakfast sandwich on the menu?
author: Stacey S.

description: I recently tried the caprese sandwich here and it fucking rocked. Must reiterate the five stars.
author: Jasmine F.

description: It's a nice place to have a cup of coffee. I love to go to Alamo square and I always stop by here and grab a coffee :)
author: Jay R.

description: Went here the other day to study after I heard they had free Internet and good coffee.  I loved the space, it has a calming effect and is pretty quiet.  The coffee is delicious, food is so so.  4 stars for the ambiance and coffee, would have probably given 3 for the food.
author: Sarah F.

description: The coffee is to die for. The staff is the sweetest and they have some of the best things to nosh on in the morning. And it is beautifully designed and bright. I love to start my mornings here. It should be illegal that this place is in my neighborhood, as my coffee and espresso intake doubled because its so yummy. I am addicted, but I am happy about it!!!!
author: London E.

description:
I was so excited to see the dark and dirty hole of a "Cafe" re-made into the light and tasteful place that it has become.  

I tried a coffee and sandwich today and was surprised by both the wonderful flavor of the coffee and yummy taste of the sandwich.   

The staff and owners still seem to be working out the kinks (they have only been opened a week now) but their enthusiasm and obvious desire to please was evident.

I hope they will continue to improve and then we will have what the neighborhood has been sorely missing for so long; a warm and friendly place to gather and converse.

I for one will continue to patronize as often as I can as I am certain the owners will learn from this first week's experience.
author: John S.

description: Not really a fan.  Love the location, staff was fine but the two times I've gone there my drink was lukewarm (chai latte and, today, regular latte).   Isn't coffee supposed to be hot or is this some new hipster deal that I've not yet heard about.  Whatever, turn up the heat for christ sake!
author: Drew W.

description: Yet another disturbing sign that the last bastion of relative affordability and non-yuppie scumdom is coming to a sad end! Somehow these people managed to take a pefectly lovely, warm inviting space and turn it into just another cold, snotty and unpleasent place  for cold, snotty and unpleasent drones to gather hacking away blindly on their laptops. PLEASE people...go back to the Marina and take the yuppies with you.
author: Shay M.

description: What a great, clean cafe with yummy lattes and good bites too.  I typically will pick up a coffee on my way to work or a bite to eat on the weekends.  I've found always friendly service and am extremely happy to support a  great local business!   I recommend trying those Mission Mini cupcakes too, they are delectable!  Don't forget, it's cash only.
author: Leslie U.

description:
Alright, it's time that I set some of these yelpers straight. 
It seems as though people have been rating this place in very strange ways. "Yeah, this place is great. Great coffee, great food. 3 stars." 
These people, obviously don't know much about the mcbaker intersection, and have obviously no memory of the terrible two, neon and one world. God damnit these places sucked so bad that it was enough to make someone walk/ride to divis to get a decent coffee. I do say decent, not good because divis doesn't have good coffee. 

That's right, this is easily the best coffee in Western Addition. And I dare you to argue with me on this. Don't even think about mentioning Mojo or Abir. Oh shit, Please don't mention Abir. That shit hole is the absolute worst. I feel like I'm on stage every time I go in there. At least, it's the worst next to the now deceased neon and one world. Anyways, let's not get off topic here. 

Why is this new place good? Hand made, drip coffee made with amazing coffee beans. One of a kind espresso and cappuccinos. Superb food, amazing decor, great music. Crap man, what else do you want in a coffee shop? Not to mention how nice the staff is. 

Yes, they're new, yes they are working out small kinks, but this place is already top notch. And they're only going to get better. I just can't wait until people start talking about how great this place is months from now. "Have you been to Matching Half? It's my favorite coffee shop." That's what they'll say. I'll just respond, "Yeah, no shitJohnny come lately, I loved it originally. When it wasn't so damn cool to love it." That's what I'll say.
author: scotty s.

description:
the staff is all very nice and the coffee is off the hook. what more could i want. i used to settle for the coffee at the old place that was here before. no more settling here. 

they take their brew seriously with out the typical coffee shop employee attitude.

highly recomend for a cup to go or better just to kick back and enjoy. 

when the weather gets better you wont be able to find a seat in this place. especially on the outdoor seats.
author: Dennis K.

description: This place is three blocks away from my house.  I've been here around 3x.  For drinks, I've only had their drip coffee and it is outstanding.  They also make a mean bagel.  They don't slop on the cream cheese, but rather spread it carefully and don't overdo it.  The breakfast sandwich is also pretty good.  They are a little bit slow, but they are so nice it really doesn't matter to me.
author: CC L.

description: Matching Half Cafe appeared out of nowhere this week on my bike route to work so I stopped in for an espresso.  Really nice inside, felt clean and minimal but comfortable.  Tables and chairs outside looked like a great place to sit in the sun.  My coffee was delicious, they carry Blue Bottle and Four Barrel.  I didn't get a chance to eat but the menu looked tasty.  Apparently they are not fully open yet, for sure I'll be back to check it out again as they get into full swing.
author: Scott S.

description:
I've lived in the western addition/panhandle area for about 6 years now, and one thing that has been sorely lacking is a place with great coffee and good, cheap beer. Cafe Abir went through all those months of renovation and somehow got worse, and Mojo just isn't my scene.

Matching Half cafe changes all that. This is hands down the best coffee in the neighborhood (and I would argue a larger territory), they have a great selection of awesome, affordable beer and wine, and a really solid food menu. The decor is simple, beautiful, and bright. The staff is nicer than you could ever imagine. 

Seriously, go. You'll love it.
author: Gavin W.

description:
Hands down the best coffee I've had since leaving Melbourne 12 months ago. Rich, dense, smooth, perfectly moussey foam - it's divine.

Fit out
The interior is lovely, simple and stylish - what, no cheese? It's a classy fit-out, and about time San Francisco got some of that. That said, they could do with some more art on the walls and it was also a little warm in there on an indian summer late morning. I adore the wall planter. (4/5)

Food
Looks like they're doing the "let's wait to order food til we see how many customers we have" thing. Which means that the food ran out REALLY early on the weekend and I didn't get to eat anything. Excusable for a first weekend, and I really hope they fix it. (-/5)

Staff
The baristas are wonderful, and everyone is very friendly. It seems like a few of the younger girls are getting their ocean legs, but hopefully they'll pcik up soon. I would also recommend that they figure out what they're doing about table service - it's not clear how/who is clearing tables. (3/5)

Coffee
If this place scored zero on everything else I would still come here for the coffee. I'm a MASSIVE coffee snob and their espresso is a beautiful thing to behold. It made me very, very happy (5/5)

Overall, I'm super excited that this place has opened up, and I look forward to watching them learn and grow. Good luck Matching Half Cafe!!
author: Terese S.

description:
i looove this place. the owners are possibly the nicest people in the neighborhood. they work 24-7. the staff is great! it has helped this corner thrive. you go in here and you get to know the owners, you understand they care about thier business and learn your name and drink fast. where as green chile, i go in 3 x a week and they have no idea i exist. 

the coffee. amazing. sightglass is on par and possibly better than blue bottle & ritual. the guys who work at sightglass there are in the cafe sometimes and super nice! the sandwiches are good. the service is great. the environment is great.
