people judge sometimes on here, but guess what, a fresh high quality cappucino isnt cheap anymore and its in small cups. its gourmet. i think its well worth it. its one of the best capps ive had. and it says something that foodies from all over the city hang here for coffee. delfins. check. quince. check. nopa staff. check. 

so glad they are here.
author: kelly M.

description: I love this coffe shop, I really do! Walking distance from home, fast internet, good food, I couldn't ask for more. As I walked in there was no one to be found over the counter, I waited for a couple of minutes for someone to show up. I asked for coffee over ice, and the "barista" replied offended: "we don't do that here". Then I asked kindly for a cup of coffee and a glass with ice ad she still answered with an attitude. Fine, I said, give me a cup of coffe, a glass with ice and I'll fix my drink when you are not watching. She looked at me confused and proceeded with making the coffee. Later, she charged me for the coffe and she was still rude.I would like to ask the Manager to be more selective while hiring, as this chubby, blondish little prick needs to learn how to deal with customers. There are way too many unemployed people out there, that could do a much better job. Please feel free to contact me with any questions.
author: paul V.

description: New fave spot in the hod ya'll.  The cat that is behind the bar usually is rocking out the reggae.  Clean, vibrant, fresh look inside with a big communal table in the back, and 2 tops along the ample windows. The coffee is aiiight but the sandwiches are delish.  Try the Mozzarella and Basil grilled sammy.  From the "weird but cool dept" : bathroom is fresh and clean.  WiFi 411:  free wifi. spotty connection,  no power outlets makes this gorilla not so happy.  Worth buying an extra battery for however.
author: Naeem N.

description:
ok so my second time in here the very nice young lady behind the counter almost set me off. i wanted med double latte in a 12oz cup.. i like a stong cup without a lot of milk. and as much as i love love loved the first cup i had here the previous day, i felt it was a bit small. so thought i would just get a bigger cup. na uh, not here.

back to the sweet young lady. she said that they felt thier coffee was perfect in that size cup with that amount of coffee. Whaaaat? i know my coffee sister. i will never question them again. i just order two cups!

you know what. i love that they take their coffee so serious and they are all still super nice. i mean lets face it coffee  shop employees tend to be the coolest cats in SF for some reason. they have more attitude than a pro-sports althlete. need an example check out how cool, they are in Cafe Abir around the corner. they are sooo cool they refuse to actually speak to you. uh hmm. soooo cool.

not here they are true barristas and they are all super coolnice and friendly.

i cant pass this place without getting a cup anymore (ok two)

oh and the icing on the cake, the food is killer as well.

great job guys
author: Jorge E.

description: I'm happy that these guys opened up shop here.  For years, my husband and I have been longing for a business of better quality to open at this location, (and the one formerly occupied by Neon).  Our wishes are finally coming true!!  I got a cup of Sumatra this morning that was nicely brewed.  It could have been a tad hotter, but it is the 2nd day of business after all.  I'll be back soon for the food!
author: Lauren M.

description:
consistently RUDE with an extra measure of atti'TUDE!
sure the coffee is good- but I honestly don't get why (in a customer service industry, and yes, that is still what it amts to) the arrogant, "don;t really give a crap" about you attitude has to be a part of it! But of course, as long as the customers  swan all around, and are misled in to thinking that this is part of the thing that makes it "chic"... well, then it will continue. I've given them lots of chances, and wondered if at first it was just me-- but I have had other people say the same thing. It comes down to this: it's a "top down" problem (and potentially, solution.) But after going in again today to see the same crap from the owner and the crew working around her-- I realize it's not going to change (unless customers demand it). So I will just take my business somewhere else... like Matching Half or even Farm Table where I feel my business is actually appreciated.
author: christina h.

description: I get up every Saturday stoked to go to this place and chill out with a delicious cup of their premium drip (Verve Roasters). I like everything about this place. They have good small breakfast items like bagels and sandos. My GF says the chai is awesome. Everyone always seems friendly to me. Definately no snobby coffee attitudes like you get at other places with comparably awesome coffee. Being somewhat of a beer snob, I am impressed with their small selection of beers too. All in all, i will always highly recommend this spot to anyone.
author: DJ A.

description: The coffee isn't hot enough in the mornings, bummer. I put cream in it and it's cold within 10 minutes.
author: Brian Z.

description: One size doesn't fit all, and even for a small size the price is steep for a soy latte.  Unapologetically without vegan cookies, donuts, or muffins.  All seating (at small tables, bar or outside) is hard.  Tables inside on a sunny day are too hot and glaring from afternoon sun.
author: Bob G.

description: Basic yes, but nicely styled.  I am extremely picky when it comes to coffee and the cappuccino was good.  The breakfast sandwich was simple yet tasty.  Very nice addition to our neighborhood.
author: Ryan S.

description: First of all, this is about 100 steps from my apartment and I have just set foot in here.  I'm actually enjoying a Chai Latte as we speak.  Victory.  It's raining, and I couldn't possibly walk a little farther to Bean Bag, so alas, here I am.  Cozy, clean--Yes. Overflowing with outlets to charge your computer? Not so much. Come here for a coffee or a mini cupcake, but if you're like me and have a bunk comp. that doesn't hold its charge, you'll be perched in the window like a trophy, next to the only outlet that works.  Ditch the computer and come with a friend instead.
author: Laura A.

description: I'm so excited that we have such a great coffee spot in our neighborhood. I go there so often that my friends have started calling The Matching Half, "Anthony's Place." The people are super friendly, the coffee is exceptional, the attitude relaxed; I even like the sign printed on brown paper. If you're ever near, definitely stop by.
author: Anthony C.

description: Dog friendly, outdoor seating, good vibe, and friendly service.  What's not to like?  Well actually, the coffee is extremely strong (individual drip style) so watch out.  And the wine list and food options are a bit short so hopefully they will expand those.
author: Russ C.

description: I am so excited!!! A great new coffee shop in my neighborhood. Perfect ambience, no crowds, tranquility and amazing space to work - the coffee is good, strong and could be better. But hey, I am a coffee snob, so that said - I give this place 5 stars.
author: Judith B.

description: Wow!  I live at this corner,  and am one happy local!  I didn't know how big of a hit this place would be.  It feels so great now to see all the people crowding around this new popular joint.  Cheers to the owners.  Great Job!   So simple, yet beautiful inside.   And super cheap eats!   Yall will definitely see a lot of me :)
author: Marqus B.

description: The coffee is cheap and tasty, the food smells and looks amazing. The gourmet pop tarts are delicious (try the jalapeno!). The only downside is the lack of electric plugs, but they probably do that on purpose to keep students like me from posting up all day and only buying one cup of coffee...
author: J J.

description:
Nice atmosphere, something that feels like the Mission but in the Panhandle - which is nice. Clean, modern and quiet. This is what makes it a 3 star place instead of a 2. 

My complaint is about the coffee. They call it drip, even go through the trouble of pouring hot water into your cub and then pouring it out to heat it up, and then pour the pre-made coffee out of a thermos! There is nothing drip about that. 

My second complaint is the WiFi is spotty.
author: Sean R.

description: just got the kale salad to go.  Not enough dressing to make eating raw kale worth it.  Please note.
author: Sheila S.

description: Was on a bike ride and stopped in. A great neighborhood cafe. You can feel the love.
author: lucas b.

description:
Love love love. 
I love popping in for a quick coffee fix. Sightglass coffee is one of my favorites. It's best when they aren't busy and they are able to make a drip coffee from scratch. 

Thank goodness they have bar seating which is usually available. It can be frustrating and a total bummer when you expect to just sit for 10 minutes with a coffee and a quick bit, and laptops are spread out everywhere. That being said- the visitors to this cafe are pretty chill and seem to sit to the back large table and leave the smaller tables or bar free. Also there is no where to plug a computer in, and that keeps traffic moving (great idea!) 
Great granola- definitely expensive for a breakfast, but it's a nice weekend treat. It's definitely much fresher than other cafes, and they use good yogurt/honey.
 I love their salads and the unusual paninis. I've never had the egg bagel, but it looks pretty good. 
The owners are always really happy and polite, however some of the newer hires have been a little intimidating to order from. This cafe always seems so upbeat, happy, efficient, so the grumpy barista's should go get a job at Cafe Tude where they indulge in giving halfass service.
 (ie: one day they were out of the yogurt for the granola bowl, so she said in her rough tone she said they were all out - but the owner stepped in quickly and said he could use milk if we wanted, which was fine with us. He saved the sale because we were just about to walk out and find breakfast elsewhere, but in the end we stayed!)
author: Alexandra a.

description: I came here a few days ago.  I was pleasant surprised how nice the space is.  I had seen this place before it turns into the cafe it is today, and I think the owners did a great job to transform this space.  The space is welcoming, lots of light.  And the use of space is great, lots of seating, and the place is clean overall.  The first problem I had was the cappuccino.  The milk wasn't frothed properly.  The top was covered with large bubbles, instead of a nice shinny microfoam.  Second problem is with the pastry.  I know they don't make it themselves.  I ordered the nutella pop tart made by Black Jet.  After I cut it in halves, one half of it has no nutella at all.  May be the pop tart was heated in a toaster, so when it was heated, all the nutella went to the bottom halve.  Before I left, I showed the leftover of the half pop tart to the staff.  I told her that there's no filling in it.  She looked at the opened up pop tart, didn't say anything, and walked away.  Better barista and better service would make this place 4 start for me.
author: Tim R.

description: Rocket  fuel  for  the  masses! Really  great, fresh  coffee  and  only  $2.00!
author: Spike B.

description: Holy !@#% the coffee is strong. I like Peets and Blue Bottle but this is going too far. Hit me in the gut like a cannon ball. Be warned!
author: John C.

description: I'm pretty sure cafe life doesn't get better than this (seriously). Great coffee, delicious food, beautiful atmosphere.
author: Martina D.

description:
living directly on the block of MH, i eagerly awaited as i watched it being built. passing it every morning with lots of hope of having coffee in the morning and drinks in the evening.
well.... it sucks monkey balls!!!!
two dollars for a small coffee that tasted funny??? then for the rude cashier to be totally dismissive towards me??? hummm, not interested.
i was willing to give it another chance, but reading the other yelp reviews, its showing that it wasnt me being overly sensitive, as rude service has been dished to the others..... ill keep my dollars and get coffee a decent cup for 1.25 downtown and call it a day.

ohhh and the fact that this place is sooooo lilly white.... there is no flavor going on what-so-ever. like one of the other yelpers said.... go back to the marina, and take the yuppies with you. i muched liked it when it was a dingy coffee house with a make shift print screen outfit on the other corner and a greasy spoon opposite of that...  yes the yuppies have taken over.... they suck, my money stays in my pocket and i will just look at them with disgust as i do every morning when i walk by. same for green chilli...
author: tiffany h.

description: Very high quality coffee drinks, cozy decor, and friendly vibe. Achilles heel is the food-- so-so sandwiches and salads at rather high prices. I drink lattes and coffees here several times a week and think it serves some of the best coffee drinks in the city.
author: Jane R.

description: Do not come here if you plan on working. They have no power outlets for use except an awkward one under the cream and sugar counter, which would barely reach one table. I tried to cancel my latte order once I realized this but the rude woman at the counter basically told me I was out of luck. They weren't even done making my drink! I left without my coffee and $3.25 poorer because I didn't want to bring it into another cafe.
author: Lisa E.

description: mmm.  this place is the shiznit.  who says SF doesn't need another higher-end coffee joint?   it's great to be able to grab a first rate cup of coffee on the way to work and a beer on the way home.  as far as new businesses go, this place really has what it takes. 5 stars.
author: michael s.

description: this place is the jam.  good people and good coffee.  what else do you need.  oh - and for the cafe abir person... you can stay there.  we don't want you at matching half.  we will keep our patience and cute owl t-shirts out of your way.
author: Jeff W.

description:
when the alarm goes off on monday mornings i literally pry myself out of bed thinking of this coffee. the drip here is simply delicious.  the pours never fail to be strong and the coffee has a distinct taste that will make you question why all coffee doesnt taste this good.  

the interior is crisp, a little pretentious at times but the clean decor will allow the shop to grow easily. my one complaint is that they dont open until 7!  a half hour earlier and id give them 5 stars.
author: devin d.

description:
i really want to like this place, but i just can't give it a good rating.  their coffee is usually cold, only comes in one nice, and takes about 20 minutes even for just a drip.  they need to re-think their business plan a bit.

that being said, the people are nice outside of the loud parties they have thrown that i'm fairly sure are not legal.
author: Jennifer S.

description: just had the most pretentious coffee buying experience of my life here. i walked in and ordered an espresso to go. sounds simple, right? the barista took a long pause, got a funny look on her face, and responded with "yeeeah, we don't do espresso to-go here." looking confused, i wondered if they were out of to-go cups or something. "see, the owner doesn't want us to make espresso to-go, because the crema sticks to the inside of the paper cup... and it's just not how you drink espresso." she explained. seeing clearly that logic and customer desire had nothing to do with the argument, i began to leave. "wait." she called after me. i turned back to the counter. "i can make one just for you." she whispered. i agreed, paying two dollars for the espresso and one dollar for a tip. after what seemed like a really long time for just an espresso, she put my drink on the counter. it was a small cup with less than one ounce of average looking espresso in it... i mean, it barely covered the bottom of the cup. i'm not good at math, but it cost me more than a dollar a sip plus some embarrassment on the side. in the end, i'd much rather go to a place that will just give me what i ask for than one that wants to teach me an expensive lesson about how i should drink my coffee.
author: zachary p.

description: The pastries and sandwiches are solid. The lattes are good, but the drink menu is more minimalist than what I prefer in a coffee shop. The brown packaging paper with sharpie makes me too nervous to request any deviation for risk of being told what I want is NOT an option.
author: Raquel P.

description: this new joint was a welcome surprise.  the interior is positively serene and really highlights the charms of the space.  great coffee and a very functional outdoor seating area made for a perfect morning.  i'm sure this place will come into its own in good time.
author: Philip M.
